item.name: Damascena
entries: This basic technology invented by the Scions sacrifices {@item lead bullet|SGttEH|lead bullets} to generate powerful azure flames that scorch the abhorrent. This device is an effort to replicate the magical ability possessed by a select few.

As an action, you can cause the damascena to project blue flames in a 15-foot cone in front of you. Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 11} + your proficiency bonus), taking {@damage 4d4} fire damage + a number of {@dice d4|d4s} equal to your proficiency bonus on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each use of the damascena consumes 5 {@item lead bullet|SGttEH|lead bullets}.

item.name: Deadly Potion of Poison
entries: {@note This "deadly" variant deals twice the amount of poison damage as a regular {@item potion of poison}.}

This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a {@item potion of healing} or other beneficial potion. However, it is actually poison masked by illusion magic. An {@spell identify} spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you take {@damage 6d6} poison damage, and you must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. At the start of each of your turns while you are {@condition poisoned} in this way, you take {@damage 6d6} poison damage. At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, the poison damage you take on your subsequent turns decreases by {@dice 1d6}. The poison ends when the damage decreases to 0.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the executioner is a {@item scythe|SGttEH} and a lantern. In its transformed state, the weapon is a single massive {@item maul|PHB}.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: When you hit a creature with the {@item scythe|SGttEH}, as part of the same attack, you can choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach to attack. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to half your initial hit. If you do so, your speed is halved until the end of your turn. In addition, the executioner has the Harvest Property.

entries.name: Harvest
entries: Whenever a creature of CR 1 or higher (or 1st level or higher) dies within 15 feet of you, the lantern harvests the creature's soul. The soul becomes trapped in the lantern and the creature cannot be resurrected until the soul is freed. As an action, you can free a soul trapped in the lantern. The lantern can hold a maximum of one soul.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: The {@item maul|PHB} gains the Soul Explosion property.

entries.name: Soul Explosion
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can sacrifice one of the souls held in the lantern to create a massive explosion of ghostflame, permanently destroying the soul. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} radiant damage and {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead automatically fail the saving throw.

item.name: Electric Sawblade
entries: The electric sawblade is a viciously effective tool of war that combines the lethality of silver and electricity. The hilt and guard resemble those of a hunter's {@item longsword|PHB}, often ornately adorned with the markings of the hunter's faction, symbols of the Radiant Church, or grim skulls that embody the dominion over death of the Scions. From this hilt extends the true terror of the weapon: a broad, straight blade constructed from dozens of razor-sharp, silvered teeth arranged in a looped chain. When wielded, these teeth whirr into a blur of destructive motion, capable of rending flesh, bone, and even the thick hide of beasts with horrifying ease. A powerful generator housed within the hilt infuses the gnashing teeth with crackling energy, adding a galvanizing quality to each cut and rip.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: This {@item longsword|PHB} has 3 charges. You can expend 1 charge as a bonus action to pull the trigger under the blade to transform and infuse it with electricity for 1 minute, until you fall unconscious, or until you use a bonus action to stop the current. This weapon regains 1 charge for each 10 minutes that it spends inside a miniature Galespire Coil (often found inside hunter's workshops).

This silvered {@item longsword|PHB} deals an extra {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls against creatures not wearing metal armor, as long as the sword has at least 1 charge.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: When a melee attack that you can see would hit you, you can use your reaction to parry the attack, adding a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus against that attack. If this causes the attack to miss you and it was made with a nonmagical weapon, the weapon is destroyed by the teeth of the sawblade.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: The surge of electricity causes the blade to rev faster, requiring both hands to control it. If you use one hand to attack with this sword while it is transformed, you have disadvantage on attack rolls made with it. While transformed, the {@item longsword|PHB} deals an extra {@damage 1d6} slashing and {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. In addition, the momentum generated from it propels you. Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

item.name: Ethereal Moongold Equalizer
entries: This weapon, crafted with moongold, gives you a {@damage 1d4} bonus to damage rolls against nonhumanoid creatures. Moongold acts as a guiding light in the darkness; creatures holding or wearing moongold have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and madness.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: This weapon has 5 charges and regains them daily at midnight. While attuned to this weapon, you can expend a charge to turn ephemeral, granting you the ability to walk through objects and creatures as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3} until the end of your turn. If you end your turn inside an object or creature, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically melt the moongold before solidifying it, switching between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the equalizer is a {@item flintlock|SGttEH}. In its transformed state, the weapon is an ornate, two-handed weapon; a {@item rifle|SGttEH}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: This {@item flintlock|SGttEH} has the {@itemProperty SGttEH:Bar|SGttEH|Barrel} 2 {@itemProperty SGttEH:FRel|SGttEH|(F)} property. In addition, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature or targeting a {@condition prone} creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with this {@item flintlock|SGttEH}.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: When you attack with this weapon, you can choose to replace your attack with a particularly violent shot. Make a ranged weapon attack and expend up to 5 charges. On a hit, the target takes the weapon's damage plus an extra {@damage 2d8} piercing damage + an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage for each charge expended. If you expended more than 2 charges for the attack, the target is also {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. Hit or miss, this causes the weapon to partially liquefy and turn back into its untransformed state; it can't be transformed again until the end of your next turn.
You can use this attack only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use this attack, your speed is 0 until the end of your turn.

item.name: Explosive Bullets (10)
entries: {@note See {@item Explosive Bullet|SGttEH}.}

item.name: Faux Lunaire
entries: If you cast the {@spell light} cantrip targeting this weapon, the carved runes activate. For the duration of the spell, as long as you hold the weapon, your Wisdom score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, and you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: The Faux Lunaire is a wickedly curved scythe crafted from an arcane alloy and engraved with lunar imagery and celestial runes. With a swift, spinning motion, the limbs of the blade and shaft of the scythe fold in and rotate around the grip, locking into place to form an ornate longbow. As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. As part of the bonus action, you can also magically teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. In its untransformed state, this weapon is a scythe. In its transformed state, it's a longbow.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with this weapon, you can force it to make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, becoming affected by the {@spell faerie fire} spell on a failure. You do not need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on this spell, but it ends early if you put another creature under the effect of the spell, or if you fall {@condition unconscious}.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: In its transformed state, the Faux Lunaire has 2 charges. When you attack a creature with this bow, you can expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells (save {@dc 17}) from it (no action required): {@spell moonbeam} or {@spell darkness}. The spell is centered on the creature's space and lasts until the end of your next turn. You do not need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on it, and you can only have one of these spells active at a time. If your attack misses, you expend the charge but the effect fails. The Faux Lunaire regains 1 expended charge each time it is targeted by the {@spell light} cantrip.

item.name: First Carving, Drawn
entries: The original carving, The Right Hand of Creation, is the first sign the Old Ones left behind when devoted worshipers implored for divine help against the Scourge. The price for such power is still being paid to this day.
None have seen the full power of this carving, as the original is sealed deep within the earth, guarded by a sin left behind by the Radiant Church.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: At the end of a long rest, you gain the effect of a {@spell sanctuary} spell that lasts until the start of your next long rest (the spell can end early as normal). The saving throw DC for the spell equals 8 + your Constitution or Wisdom modifier (whichever is higher) + your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Wings of Salvation
entries: In addition, when a willing creature you can see within 60 feet of you is targeted by an attack roll or forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to give them wings to fly out of danger. A pair of angelic wings sprout on their back, which carries them in a straight line to you, where they land in an unoccupied space next to you. This can potentially cause the harmful effect to miss if the creature leaves the range of the effect. The wings then vanish. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: First Carving, Scarified
entries: The original carving, The Right Hand of Creation, is the first sign the Old Ones left behind when devoted worshipers implored for divine help against the Scourge. The price for such power is still being paid to this day.

This can potentially cause the harmful effect to miss if the creature leaves the range of the effect. The wings then vanish. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: At the end of a long rest, you gain the effect of the {@spell death ward} spell cast on yourself.

In addition, you can use Wings of Salvation twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Further, when you use Wings of Salvation, as part of the reaction, you can cast {@spell warding bond} on the target. You do not need to provide the spell slot or material components for the spell, but you need to {@status concentration|PHB|concentrate} on this spell to maintain it.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: You can use Wings of Salvation a number of times equal to Constitution or Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Devour Sin
entries: Upon death, your body is immediately struck by the {@spell true resurrection} spell. Alternatively, if a creature dies while under the effect of {@spell warding bond} cast through your Wings of Salvation, the creature is affected by {@spell true resurrection}. Once Devour Sin grants its effects, the carving loses all power for 3 days.

Further, when you use Wings of Salvation, as part of the reaction, you can cast {@spell warding bond} on the target. You do not need to provide the spell slot or material components for the spell, but you need to {@status concentration|PHB|concentrate} on this spell to maintain it.

item.name: Flare
entries: Used to indicate your position during hunts.

item.name: Galvanized Claw
entries: Ripping the flesh of the beasts they slay to fashion ferocious weapons is something hunters have gotten remarkably good at over the course of their hunts.
While attuned to this weapon, you have resistance to lightning and thunder damage.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the claw is a sinewy leather gauntlet, made from the muscle and hide of a galvanized prowler. In its transformed state, the claw surges with electrical energy, merging with its wearer's forearm and turning into a monstrous claw.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: The bestial hide invigorates you, giving you the lightning fast reflexes of the {@creature galvanized prowler|SGttEH} slaughtered to make this gauntlet; you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, this gauntlet feeds off of your power. If you have temporary hit points when you hit with a melee attack, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

The gauntlet has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you take lighting or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge to instead take no damage and gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage you would have taken.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: The gauntlet merges with your form, turning your hand into an aberrant claw that you cannot be disarmed of. This claw changes the damage of your unarmed strikes to {@damage 1d8}, the damage type to slashing, and you can use your Dexterity or Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls made with it. Further, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

When you use the {@action Attack} action with this claw, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action. In addition, if you have temporary hit points, when you hit with a melee attack using this claw, you deal an extra {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.
The claw is too unwieldy to use for delicate handling, such as activating intricate mechanisms (like the trigger of a firearm) or picking locks with {@item thieves' tools|PHB}.

item.name: Gravitational Partisan
entries: A {@item sanctified partisan|SGttEH} that was reinforced using gravity magic, typically given to high ranking hunters.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the gravitational partisan is a {@item spear|PHB} and a {@item shield|PHB}. In its transformed state, the {@item spear|PHB} is sheathed by the {@item shield|PHB}, which retracts into a massive blade; the weapon becomes a {@item glaive|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Using this pair of weapons together requires the {@item spear|PHB} to be held in one hand and the {@item shield|PHB} in the other. When you are targeted by a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to deflect with the {@item shield|PHB}, gaining a +4 bonus to AC against that attack. If the attack misses, you can immediately make a single melee weapon attack with the {@item spear|PHB} as part of the same reaction. On a hit, as part of the attack, you can transform the weapon and a gravity barrier forms in front of you, granting you a +4 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: This {@item glaive|PHB} doesn't have the {@itemProperty H||heavy} property. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, as part of the attack, you can pierce the target, transform the weapon, and only pull out the {@item spear|PHB}. The {@item shield|PHB} remains in the target's body, impaling it. An impaled creature takes {@damage 2d4} slashing damage at the start of each of its turns, and its speed is reduced to 0. To remove the {@item shield|PHB}, the impaled target can use its action to make a {@dc 14} Strength check. Medium or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the check. On a success, the {@item shield|PHB} is removed and falls at the target's feet. If you are within 5 feet of the {@item shield|PHB}, you can use a bonus action to retrieve and don it.

item.name: Greater Holy Tonic
entries: The mostly-clear tonic in this vial is slightly milky and sparkles when light shines through. It was originally created by a secretive branch of the Radiant Church.
When you drink this tonic, you regain {@dice 6d4 + 6} hit points and are cured of all diseases you currently suffer from.

entries.name: Side Effects
entries: Depending on the lore your game implements, the holy tonic can have one or more of the following side effects. These effects are hidden from player characters and no magic can reveal them.

items: If you fall {@condition unconscious} within {@dice 1d12} minutes after drinking the holy tonic, you must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table long-term madness|SGttEH} when you regain consciousness.

1 hour after you drink the holy tonic, you hear whispering voices urging you toward violence and chaos. You must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on any {@skill Persuasion} checks for the next {@dice 1d4} hours. Additionally, for the duration, you are compelled to act on aggressive impulses as determined by the GM.
24 hours after you drink the holy tonic, you must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}.

24 hours after you drink the holy tonic, you must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or crave more holy tonic. For the next {@dice 1d4} hours, you desperately search for a holy tonic and drink the first one you find. If you do not drink one within this time, you gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} and the craving goes away.

Each subsequent holy tonic you drink in a 7-day period increases the DCs for the saving throws you must make by 1. Each three holy tonics you drink in a 7-day period increases any {@condition exhaustion} levels the tonic causes by 1.

If you fail five Wisdom saving throws caused by a holy tonic within a 7-day period, a curse fully takes hold. You undergo a horrifying transformation into a monstrous beast, losing control of your actions and permanently becoming a beast or monstrosity of the GM's choice under their control.

item.name: Guillotine Shears
entries: The guillotine shears are a wonder of mechanical engineering, created to tend to Carmella's garden. Once used to cut excess foliage, it has now been repurposed to sever limbs instead of greenery. This trick weapon was given to hunters as a means of containing the scourge—if they couldn't kill the beasts, they could at least cripple them.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the guillotine is two one-handed weapons—a {@item longsword|PHB} and a {@item shortsword|PHB}. In its transformed state, the weapon is a single one-handed weapon—{@item shears|SGttEH}. As part of this bonus action, you can do the following:

items: When transforming the swords into {@item shears|SGttEH}: you can make a single melee weapon attack with the {@item shears|SGttEH}. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative, and you can't use the Guillotine property on this attack.

When transforming the {@item shears|SGttEH} into swords: you can slide the {@item longsword|PHB} forward as part of dismounting it, making a single melee weapon attack with it. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative. If you have the {@optfeature Two-Weapon Fighting} Style, you can ignore this limitation.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: While wielding both swords, the {@item longsword|PHB} is considered light. The {@item shortsword|PHB} deals your choice of slashing or piercing damage.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: The {@item shears|SGttEH} are a one-handed martial weapon that deals {@damage 1d10} slashing damage on a hit. In addition, it has the Guillotine property.

entries.name: Guillotine
entries: Immediately after hitting a target with the {@item shears|SGttEH}, if you have a free hand, you can use your reaction to pull the lever, snapping the blades together and dealing an extra {@damage 1d12} slashing damage to the target. If the triggering attack was a critical hit, you deal an extra {@damage 1d12} slashing damage. If this attack deals more than one-quarter of a creature's hit point maximum, you also {@table Losing Limbs|SGttEH|chop off one the creature's limbs (anything but the head) at the GM's discretion}. If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it is decapitated.

item.name: Hand of Glory
entries: A hand of glory is crafted from the hand of a hanged scourgeborne after it was covered in corpse wax and left to ferment in a casket.
While holding the hand of glory, you can attune to one additional magical item. This magical item can only be a ring, and must be worn on the hand of glory.

While holding the hand, you can use an action to set a digit of the hand ablaze and cast the {@spell invisibility} spell on yourself. While a finger is ablaze, it casts {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} in a 10-foot radius that is only visible to the wearer of the hand. The spell ends early if the flame is extinguished by the wearer (no action required). In addition, while a finger is ablaze, you can cast the {@spell knock} spell at will on objects within the radius of the light. The hand has 5 digits and regenerates 1 burnt digit daily at dusk.

item.name: Heart of Darkness
entries: A heart of darkness is a humanoid heart that has crystallized and absorbed enough eldritch energy to become a physical manifestation of pure chaos. Inside the thin crystal exterior is a rotten, fleshy heart that still beats and pulses with heat. A creature with the heart in its possession must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each hour or be {@condition charmed} by the heart for 1 minute. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way has an insatiable desire to devour the heart of darkness.

If eaten during the tempering ceremonies in {@adventure areas 7 and 11|SGttEH-EoM|1|7. Heart Well}, the heart's energy strengthens the volunteer's mind or body (the boons are described in their respective areas). Otherwise, the heart of darkness grants a random permanent benefit and consequence if ingested. Nothing short of a {@spell wish} spell can remove these effects. Roll a {@dice d4} on each of the following lists to determine what those are:

entries.name: Benefits:
items: The creature gains immunity to psychic damage, as the chaotic energy protects its mind from psychic attacks.
The creature gains the ability to teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 15 feet of itself as a bonus action, as it has tapped into the power of chaos to bend space and time.
The creature can spend its hit dice as an action instead of at the end of a short rest, allowing it to heal more frequently and during combat.

The creature gains proficiency in Constitution saving throws, as its increased durability and resilience allow it to resist effects that would normally debilitate it completely. If the creature is already proficient, it gains a +2 bonus to Constitution saving throws.

entries.name: Consequences:
items: The creature suffers disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws, as the constant hallucinations and visions cause it to mentally become weaker.
The creature becomes vulnerable to force damage, as the eldritch energy rejects arcane force, disrupting the body.
The creature gains a random temporary negative effect that changes at the end of each day, chosen by the GM, as the crystal heart's energy is unstable and causes unpredictable side effects.
The creature suffers disadvantage on ability checks involving Intelligence and Charisma as the eldritch energy dulls its cognitive faculties.

item.name: Holy Tonic
entries: The mostly-clear tonic in this vial is slightly milky and sparkles when light shines through. It was originally created by a secretive branch of the Radiant Church.
When you drink this tonic, you regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points and are cured of all diseases you currently suffer from.

Additionally, for the duration, you are compelled to act on aggressive impulses as determined by the GM.

24 hours after you drink the holy tonic, you must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or crave more holy tonic. For the next {@dice 1d4} hours, you desperately search for a holy tonic and drink the first one you find. If you do not drink one within this time, you gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} and the craving goes away.

Each subsequent holy tonic you drink in a 7-day period increases the DCs for the saving throws you must make by 1. Each three holy tonics you drink in a 7-day period increases any {@condition exhaustion} levels the tonic causes by 1.

If you fail five Wisdom saving throws caused by a holy tonic within a 7-day period, a curse fully takes hold. You undergo a horrifying transformation into a monstrous beast, losing control of your actions and permanently becoming a beast or monstrosity of the GM's choice under their control.

item.name: Hunter's Kit
entries: Includes:

items: 20 {@item bullet|SGttEH|lead bullets}
a {@item silvered dagger|PHB}
a {@item flare|SGttEH}
a {@item flask|PHB|silver flask}

item.name: Improved Guillotine Shears
entries: You have a +2 to attack and damage rolls made with both forms of this weapon.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the guillotine is two one-handed weapons—a {@item longsword|PHB} and a {@item shortsword|PHB}. In its transformed state, the weapon is a single one-handed weapon—{@item shears|SGttEH}. As part of this bonus action, you can do the following:

items: When transforming the swords into {@item shears|SGttEH}: you can make a single melee weapon attack with the {@item shears|SGttEH}. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative, and you can't use the Guillotine property on this attack.

When transforming the {@item shears|SGttEH} into swords: you can slide the {@item longsword|PHB} forward as part of dismounting it, making a single melee weapon attack with it. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative. If you have the {@optfeature Two-Weapon Fighting} Style, you can ignore this limitation.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: While wielding both swords, the {@item longsword|PHB} is considered light. The {@item shortsword|PHB} deals your choice of slashing or piercing damage. Whenever you damage a creature with both swords on the same turn, it takes extra slashing damage equal to your choice of either your Strength or Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Transformed
entries: The {@item shears|SGttEH} are a one-handed martial weapon that deals {@damage 1d12} slashing damage on a hit and scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20. In addition, it has the Guillotine property.

entries.name: Guillotine
entries: Immediately after hitting a target with the {@item shears|SGttEH}, if you have a free hand, you can use your reaction to pull the lever, snapping the blades together and dealing an extra {@damage 1d12} slashing damage to the target. If the triggering attack was a critical hit, you deal an extra {@damage 3d12} slashing damage. If this attack deals more than one quarter of a creature's hit point maximum, you also {@table Losing Limbs|SGttEH|chop off one the creature's limbs (anything but the head) at the GM's discretion}. If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it is decapitated.

item.name: Improved Meat Hookshot
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with both forms of this magic weapon.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the hookshot is two one-handed weapons connected by a short length of chain; a {@item sickle|PHB} and a {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH}. In its transformed state, the weapon is a single two-handed weapon; a {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} with a bladed attachment that can act as a {@item battleaxe|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: While untransformed, the {@item sickle|PHB} has the {@itemProperty F||finesse} property, and the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} doesn't have the {@itemProperty 2H||two-handed} property. Using this pair of weapons together requires the {@item sickle|PHB} to be held in one hand and the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} in the other. When you take the {@action Attack} action with the {@item sickle|PHB}, you can make an attack with the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} as a bonus action, ignoring the {@itemProperty SGttEH:Bar|SGttEH|Barrel} property. If you hit a creature with the {@item sickle|PHB} and the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} on the same turn, it has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can attack with either the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} or the bladed attachment (which uses the stats of a {@item battleaxe|PHB} wielded with two hands). In addition, this item gains the Hookshot property.

entries.name: Hookshot
entries: As an action, you can launch the {@item sickle|PHB} from the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH}, to which it remains attached by a length of sturdy chain. Make a ranged weapon attack against a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} plus your Dexterity modifier. If the creature is of your size or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pulled in a straight line to the nearest unoccupied space adjacent to you. If the creature is of a size larger than yours, you are pulled in a straight line to the nearest unoccupied space adjacent to it. At the end of your turn, you can detach the hook from the creature and reattach it to the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH}; if you don't, the creature is {@condition grappled} by you.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: When you attune to this item, the cold, lifeless hand merges with your flesh and either replaces a missing arm or consumes one of your existing arms (your choice when you attune to this weapon). An arm consumed in this way does not reappear when you unattune from the item.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the phantom limb is a metallic, articulating hand. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item shortsword|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Unarmed strikes you make with the phantom limb deal magical bludgeoning damage. If a creature damaged by your unarmed strikes has an ability that would allow it to walk through objects and creatures (such as a ghost's incorporeal movement), it loses that ability until the start of your next turn. In addition, the limb reacts to deflect incoming blows, granting you a +2 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this {@item shortsword|PHB}, which gains the Haunting Mark property. While the weapon is in this form, you can't be possessed.

entries.name: Haunting Mark
entries: Whenever you hit an undead creature with an attack using this blade then, for the next minute, you can see its form as a glowing outline, even if it is {@condition invisible}, and you always know the direction and distance to the creature while it is on the same plane as you. This effect ends early if you hit a different undead creature with an attack using this blade, or if the phantom limb is no longer in its transformed state.

item.name: Improved Ravenous Gazer
entries: Any creature that attunes to this {@item glaive|PHB} is considered proficient with it. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the gazer is a {@item glaive|PHB}. In its transformed state, the gazer is a {@item glaive|PHB} which can be used as a spellcasting focus.

To transform this weapon, you must feed it your blood: each time you shift this weapon into its transformed state, or start your turn with the {@item glaive|PHB} in its transformed state, you take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage, which cannot be reduced in any way. This damage cannot break your {@status concentration}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: While the {@item glaive|PHB} is in its untransformed state, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier in place of your Strength modifier when making attack rolls using the {@item glaive|PHB}.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: While the {@item glaive|PHB} is in its transformed state, it grants you a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls, increases your spell save DC by 1, and gives you {@sense truesight} out to 30 feet. Further, while you aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see.

item.name: Improved Rifling Cleaver
entries: You have a +1 to attack and damage rolls made with both forms of this magic weapon.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, it is is a large {@item cleaver|SGttEH}. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item rifle|SGttEH}. You can reload the {@item rifle|SGttEH} even in its untransformed state.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: After making a melee weapon attack with this weapon, you can immediately use your bonus action to make a ranged weapon attack with the {@item rifle|SGttEH} against a creature within range that is behind you and in a straight line with you and your first target. This shot extends the weapon, transforming it.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: This {@item rifle|SGttEH} has the {@itemProperty SGttEH:Bar|SGttEH|Barrel} {@itemProperty SGttEH:FRel|SGttEH|(F)} property instead of the {@itemProperty SGttEH:Bar|SGttEH|Barrel} {@itemProperty SGttEH:SRel|SGttEH|(S)} property. Though unwieldy in melee, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the {@item rifle|SGttEH}. This attack uses your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier. The damage die for this attack is a {@damage d8}, and it deals bludgeoning damage. Your weapon then reverts to its untransformed state.

item.name: Lead Bullets (10)
entries: {@note See {@item Lead Bullet|SGttEH}.}

item.name: Leaded Blood, Drawn
entries: Though the original carving has been lost to time, the Scions have manufactured enough perfect replicas to make this one of the most widely distributed eldritch carvings, having shared them with the Church and the hunters in an apparent selfless effort to aid against the Scourge. The most recent manikins of the Scions all come with this carving drawn on their porcelain skin, as most cannot handle a deeper eldritch knowledge.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You can convert your blood into bullets. As a bonus action, you can sacrifice 3 hit points to generate 3 blood bullets. These bullets function as regular {@item lead bullet|SGttEH|lead bullets}. You can only ever have 3 blood bullets present at once; any additional bullets you create immediately liquefy. The bullets last until they're used or until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Lightning Scion, Drawn
entries: The Lightning Scion carving was unearthed by a group of arcanists delving into the mysteries of forlorn artifacts. The profound connection between electrical energy and life was unveiled before them, propelling a surge of never-before-seen technological advancements. Thus began the magnificence of the once humble faction that would come to be known as the Scions. The carving embodies the raw power that serves as the bedrock of the Scions, infusing its possessor with the force of lightning. This allows them to traverse and assail with speed beyond mortal perception, or alternatively, employ the electricity to reanimate corpses through careful stimulation of the marrow.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage.

In addition, as a bonus action, you can teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. This carving can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries: The distance you can teleport with this carving increases to 30 feet. After you teleport, your body becomes overcharged with electricity, and the next attack you make before the end of your next turn deals an extra {@damage 1d12} lightning damage on a hit.

Additionally, you can use the rampaging electricity that courses through you to cast the {@spell create undead} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you use this carving to cast this spell, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Maiden's Osteosymbiosis
entries: Head and spine severed from a {@creature Cloistered Maiden|SGttEH}, the first wielder of this accursed weapon was considered insane, even amongst madmen—after all, the difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits. To control the osteosymbiosis, one must fuse their arm to the bony corpse of an abomination of nature and pray that the gods won't punish this crime against creation.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: When you attune to this item, the warm, still moving spine merges with the bones in your arm and replaces them. Bones consumed in this way do not reappear when you unattune from the item.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and it has the Bone Explosion property.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the osteosymbiosis is embedded in your flesh, with spikes protruding from your knuckles, changing your unarmed strikes. In its transformed state, it generates a weapon made of bones. When it transforms, roll a {@dice d8} to determine the weapon's type, according to the table below. You are proficient with all the forms of this weapon.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Your unarmed attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} piercing damage. Once on each of your turns when you hit a target with an unarmed strike, you can rupture the bone spikes that grow from your hands, leaving them embedded in your prey. You deal an extra {@damage 1d4} piercing damage to your target and it gains 1 bone shard. Your bone protrusions regrow immediately.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: Your attacks with this weapon deal an extra {@damage 1d4} slashing damage and score critical hits on a roll of 19 or 20. Further, the osseous nature of this armament renders it frail. If you score a critical hit against a creature, the weapon breaks upon the target's flesh, dealing an extra {@damage 4d4} piercing damage, and the target gains 4 bone shards. The weapon then reverts to its untransformed state.

entries.name: Bone Explosion
entries: As a bonus action, you can detonate all the bone shards embedded in one of your prey. If the target is dead, the shards fail to detonate. Each creature other than you within 15 feet of the target must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage for each bone shard that detonated. On a success, it takes half as much damage. The bone shards shatter into dust and disappear. A creature with more than 2 bone shards embedded in its body has disadvantage on this saving throw.

entries.name: Maiden's Curse
entries: While attuned to this weapon, when a {@card Blood Moon of Rebirth|Eldritch Moons Deck|SGttEH} rises, the maiden's curse awakens and spreads to its owner. You must make a Wisdom saving throw against the Madness DC of the moon. If your character has a womb—or has ever had a womb in their body—on a failure, the weapon merges with you completely and you turn into a {@creature Cloistered Maiden|SGttEH} under the GM's control. If you never had a womb, on a failure, instead of transforming, you die.

item.name: Meat Hookshot
entries: When the manikin of the Sloered abattoir gained sentience, the Scions sent enforcers to quell this threat to Luyarnha's delicate existence. From the abbatoir's meat hooks and the blunderbusses of the slain enforcers, The Slaughtered—as the manikins named themselves—crafted these versatile weapons. Nicknamed "the meat hook", the hookshot is a trick weapon used by hunters to help close the gap to their prey in a devastating whirl of blades and gunpowder.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the hookshot is two one-handed weapons connected by a short length of chain; a {@item sickle|SGttEH} and a {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH}. In its transformed state, the weapon is a single two-handed weapon; a {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} with a bladed attachment that can act as a {@item battleaxe|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: While untransformed, the {@item sickle|SGttEH} has the {@itemProperty F||finesse} property, and the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} doesn't have the {@itemProperty 2H||two-handed} property. Using this pair of weapons together requires the {@item sickle|SGttEH} to be held in one hand and the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} in the other. When you take the {@action Attack} action with the {@item sickle|SGttEH}, you can make an attack with the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} as a bonus action, ignoring the {@itemProperty SGttEH:Bar|SGttEH|Barrel} property.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can attack with either the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH} or the bladed attachment (which uses the stats of a {@item battleaxe|PHB} wielded with two hands). In addition, this item gains the Hookshot property.

entries.name: Hookshot
entries: As an action, you can launch the {@item sickle|SGttEH} from the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH}, to which it remains attached by a length of sturdy chain. Make a ranged weapon attack against a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} plus your Dexterity modifier. If the creature is of your size or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pulled in a straight line to the nearest unoccupied space adjacent to you. If the creature is of a size larger than yours, you are pulled in a straight line to the nearest unoccupied space adjacent to it. At the end of your turn, the hook detaches from the creature and reattaches itself to the {@item blunderbuss|SGttEH}.

item.name: Mephitic Seal, Drawn
entries: This intricate carving is a rotten word, nauseating to those who hear it and causing plagues upon the world, or so the story goes. A rogue faction of manikins has managed to locate the original carving and have been using it to further their own goals, much to the dismay of beings of flesh—yet such power could so easily be turned against them.

entries.name: Miasma of Death
entries: As an action, you can conjure a toxic miasma in a 15-foot-radius sphere at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. The sphere spreads around corners. The miasma remains there until the end of your next turn. Each creature that is completely within the miasma at the start of its turn must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking a number of {@dice d6|d6s} of poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus and becoming {@condition poisoned} for the duration of the miasma on a failed save. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. You can use this carving twice, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
When you summon the miasma, it gains your choice of 1 property from the following list of options:

items.name: Obfuscation:
entries: The area becomes heavily obscured.

items.name: Immunity:
entries: You are immune to and ignore the effects of the miasma.

items.name: Duration:
entries: The miasma lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. You can move the miasma up to 10 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns. If this carving is scarified, you can move it up to 30 feet instead.

items.name: Radius:
entries: The radius increases to 25 feet.

items.name: Virulent:
entries: The damage dice become {@dice d12|d12s} instead of {@dice d6|d6s}.

items.name: Lingering:
entries: On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

entries: The miasma deals an extra number of {@dice d4|d4s} of acid damage equal to your proficiency bonus on a failed save. Creatures that fail the saving throw by 5 or more are {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Destruction:
entries: You can cause the miasma to exude a corrosive substance that can eat through 1-inch-thick nonmagical wood, metal, or stone each round. If you do so, the miasma ignores resistance and immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition, and constructs have disadvantage on the saving throw.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: When you summon the miasma, it instead gains your choice of 4 properties. Add the following properties to the list of options:

items.name: Protection:
entries: When you summon the miasma, you can choose a number of creatures other than yourself equal to your proficiency bonus; they are immune to the effects of the miasma. You must {@status concentration||concentrate} on this carving as you would {@status concentration||concentrate} on a spell.

items.name: Hallucinatory Toxins:
entries: You turn your miasma into powerful hallucinogens, changing its damage type from poison to psychic. The saving throw becomes an Intelligence saving throw instead. Any other property of the miasma that inflicts poison damage instead inflicts psychic damage. You cannot use the Destruction property alongside this one.

item.name: Moongilded Tarblood
entries: This weapon, crafted with moongold, gives you a {@damage 1d4} bonus to damage rolls against nonhumanoid creatures. Moongold acts as a guiding light in the darkness; creatures holding or wearing moongold have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and madness. In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

entries.name: Special Attunement
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you know one Blood Shot option of your choice from the {@class Fighter|PHB|Blood Archer Fighter|Blood Archer|SGttEH} (choose between {@optfeature Bloodboil Arrow|SGttEH|Bloodboil}, {@optfeature Constraining Arrow|SGttEH|Constraining}, {@optfeature Shadowblood Arrow|SGttEH|Shadowblood}, or {@optfeature Thunderblood Arrow|SGttEH}).

You can use this option when you make an attack with this bow. You can use this option twice, and you regain all expended uses daily at dawn. If you are a {@class Fighter|PHB|Blood Archer Fighter|Blood Archer|SGttEH}, you instead gain 2 additional uses of your {@subclassFeature Blood Shot|Fighter|PHB|Blood Archer|SGttEH|3|SGttEH} feature.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the moongilded tarblood is a {@item longbow|PHB}. In its transformed state, it's a {@item longsword|PHB}. By breaking the string, the tarblood melts and flows around the ivory handle, congealing into a {@item longsword|PHB}; if the sword handle is forcefully shoved into the blade, the weapon reverts into a {@item longbow|PHB}. Whenever you transform the weapon, the tarblood becomes unstable; your next hit with this weapon reduces the target's speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn as the tar wraps around them, before retreating to the weapon.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: The bow can fire regular ammunition, or it can fire {@item lead bullet|SGttEH|lead bullets}, the tarblood melting them into arrows.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: While this weapon is transformed, if you inflict 25 points of damage with it in a single turn against a creature that has blood, and you have no more than one use of your {@subclassFeature Blood Shot|Fighter|PHB|Blood Archer|SGttEH|3|SGttEH} remaining, you regain one use of your {@subclassFeature Blood Shot|Fighter|PHB|Blood Archer|SGttEH|3|SGttEH}.

item.name: Moongold Equalizer
entries: This weapon, crafted with moongold, gives you a {@damage 1d4} bonus to damage rolls against nonhumanoid creatures. Moongold acts as a guiding light in the darkness; creatures holding or wearing moongold have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and madness.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically melt the {@homebrew equalizer|moongold} before solidifying it, switching between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the equalizer is a {@item flintlock|SGttEH}. In its transformed state, the weapon is an ornate, two-handed weapon; a {@item rifle|SGttEH}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: This {@item flintlock|SGttEH} has the {@itemProperty SGttEH:Bar|SGttEH|Barrel} 2 {@itemProperty SGttEH:FRel|SGttEH|(F)} property. In addition, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with this {@item flintlock|SGttEH}.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: When you attack with this weapon, you can choose to replace your attack with a particularly violent shot. Make a ranged weapon attack. On a hit, the target takes the weapon's damage plus an extra {@damage 2d8} piercing damage. Hit or miss, this causes the weapon to partially liquefy and turn back into its untransformed state; it can't be transformed again until the end of your next turn.
You can use this attack only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use this attack, your speed is 0 until the end of your turn.

item.name: Nawre's Blessing, Drawn
entries: Carmella's Greenhouse was frequently referred to as a morgue because only individuals on the verge of death were accepted in its walls. Through her studies, she discovered that implanting {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH} would artificially prolong her patients' lives, despite the fact that the fungus would consume the host's soul, leaving them an empty husk. It wasn't until she granted her favors to an enigmatic being that she was able to grasp a true solution—something that would bring the dead back to life. Despite their unearthly appearance, they are totally in control of their bodies, or so she claims.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You start grasping the depth of the eldritch truth. If your body is not infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, you gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to any {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Insight}, or {@skill Religion} checks you make.

If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, your symbiotic relationship with the fungus begins. You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: Your mind gazes deep into the revelations of the void. If your body is not infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, you gain a {@dice 1d8} bonus to any Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}), Wisdom ({@skill Insight}), or Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) checks you make. In addition, you gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to all Wisdom, Intelligence and Charisma saving throws you make. This bonus increases to {@dice 1d8} on saving throws against madness.

If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, your symbiotic relationship with the fungus begins. You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells. In addition, you learn a warlock invocation of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites (you can treat invocations that require a certain warlock level as if they instead require a certain character level). When you gain a level, you can replace this invocation with another that you meet the prerequisites for.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: You become one with the eldritch truth. You die. If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, it wipes this understanding away from your brain, and if you were not dead for longer than 100 years, you come back to life over the course of an hour. The carving closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all diseases, and lifts any curses that were affecting you when you died. The fungus replaces damaged or missing organs or limbs. The more tissue you were missing, the more fungic your appearance. In addition, you gain the following benefits:

You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells. In addition, you learn a warlock invocation of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites (you can treat invocations that require a certain warlock level as if they instead require a certain character level). When you gain a level, you can replace this invocation with another that you meet the prerequisites for.

If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you do not fall {@condition unconscious}. You still make death saving throws and can be stabilized as normal. If you are stable for 1 minute, you regain 1 hit point.

If you die and haven't taken fire or radiant damage within the last minute, you come back to life with 1 hit point after an hour. If you are exposed to fire or radiant damage during that period, you do not resurrect.

Despite their unearthly appearance, they are totally in control of their bodies, or so she claims.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You start grasping the depth of the eldritch truth. If your body is not infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, you gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to any {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Insight}, or {@skill Religion} checks you make.

If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, your symbiotic relationship with the fungus begins. You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: Your mind gazes deep into the revelations of the void. If your body is not infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, you gain a {@dice 1d8} bonus to any Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}), Wisdom ({@skill Insight}), or Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) checks you make. In addition, you gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to all Wisdom, Intelligence and Charisma saving throws you make. This bonus increases to {@dice 1d8} on saving throws against madness.

If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, your symbiotic relationship with the fungus begins. You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells. In addition, you learn a warlock invocation of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites (you can treat invocations that require a certain warlock level as if they instead require a certain character level). When you gain a level, you can replace this invocation with another that you meet the prerequisites for.

item.name: Orphan's Cradle
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In both states, the weapon is a {@item morningstar|PHB} with the {@itemProperty R||reach} property.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: The flowers growing in the cradle exude a sickly sweet scent that calms the mind of men and chases away nightmares. Humanoids within 10 feet of the cradle have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} condition. In addition, the cradle has the Vile Miasma and Cleansing Miasma properties.

entries.name: Vile Miasma
entries: When you hit a beast or an undead with orphan's cradle, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, even if the target is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Vile Miasma for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Cleansing Miasma
entries: As an action, you can cleanse one humanoid you can see within 10 feet of you. It gains {@dice 1d12} temporary hit points and can end one of the following conditions: {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned}. Once a creature has benefited from this property, it can't benefit from it again for 1 hour.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: When transformed, the cradle's plants ignite, and it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a hit. In addition, the weapon gains the Fanned Flames and Withering Flames properties.

entries.name: Fanned Flames
entries: As an action you can rotate the cradle wildly around you, fanning the flames. Each creature in a 20-foot cone in front of you must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} fire damage and {@damage 3d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Beasts and undead have disadvantage on this saving throw. After using this property, orphan's cradle reverts to its untransformed state and can't be transformed again for {@dice 1d4−1} rounds.

entries.name: Withering Flames
entries: When you hit a beast or an undead with orphan's cradle, you can force the target to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target becomes vulnerable to your choice of one of the following damage types until the start of its next turn: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or radiant. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cradle's Withering Flames for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Phantasmal Executioner
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the executioner is a {@item scythe|SGttEH} and a lantern. In its transformed state, weapon is a single massive {@item maul|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: When you hit a creature with the {@item scythe|SGttEH}, as part of the same attack, you can choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach to attack. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to your initial hit. If you do so, your speed is halved until the end of your turn. In addition, the executioner has the Harvest property.

entries.name: Harvest
entries: Whenever a creature of CR 1 or higher (or 1st level or higher) dies within 15 feet of you, the lantern harvests the creature's soul. The soul becomes trapped in the lantern and the creature cannot be resurrected until the soul is freed. As an action, you can free a soul trapped in the lantern. The lantern can hold a maximum of three souls.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: The {@item maul|PHB} gains the Soul Explosion and Undying Light properties.

entries.name: Soul Explosion
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can sacrifice one of the souls held in the lantern to create a massive explosion of ghostflame, permanently destroying the soul. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} radiant damage and {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead automatically fail the saving throw.

entries.name: Undying Light
entries: If the lantern is holding at least one soul, the {@item maul|PHB} sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Each creature of your choice that enters the bright light for the first time on a turn or start its turn there must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on any attack roll that isn't against you until the start of its next turn. Undead automatically fail the saving throw.

item.name: Phantom Limb
entries: Infusing the bones of a beast with a mixture of quicksilver, mithral, and osteomantic magic, the Scions created a means of returning disabled hunters to the battlefield in full fighting form. Dark and metallic, the crevices of a phantom limb glow with a wan, cold light when fused with the warm body of its wielder.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: When you attune to this item, the cold, lifeless hand merges with your flesh and either replaces a missing arm or consumes one of your existing arms (your choice when you attune to this weapon). An arm consumed in this way does not reappear when you unattune from the item.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the phantom limb is a metallic, articulating hand. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item shortsword|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Unarmed strikes you make with the phantom limb deal magical bludgeoning damage. In addition, the limb reacts to deflect incoming blows, granting you a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this {@item shortsword|PHB}, which gains the Haunting Mark property.

entries.name: Haunting Mark
entries: Whenever you hit an undead creature with an attack using this blade then, for the next minute, you can see its form as a glowing outline, even if it is {@condition invisible}, and you always know the direction and distance to the creature while it is on the same plane as you. This effect ends early if you hit a different undead creature with an attack using this blade, or if the phantom limb is no longer in its transformed state.

item.name: Prophecy
item.reqAttune: by a creature with a Strength of 15 or higher
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While attuned to it, your sight improves as your vision starts echoing with that of the blade. While holding prophecy, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can't be surprised
Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.
You are immune to being {@condition blinded}, as the sword absorbs the effect and closes two of its eyes instead, before regrowing them.
You have {@sense truesight} out to 30 feet.

You can cast the {@spell arcane eye} spell at will, requiring no material components and using prophecy as your spellcasting focus. When cast in this way, the magical eye also has {@sense truesight} out to 30 feet.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the weapon is a {@item cleaver|SGttEH} studded with eyeballs. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item whip|PHB} composed of metal shards held together by a sinew of blood and flesh.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: When you hit a creature with this {@item cleaver|SGttEH}, you curse them for the next hour. For the duration, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with the weapon against the target, any attack roll you make with the weapon against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19, or 20 on the {@dice d20}, and you have advantage on any {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} check you make to find the target. The curse ends early if you transform the weapon or if you fall {@condition unconscious}.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: This {@item whip|PHB} deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit, has the {@itemProperty V||versatile} ({@damage 1d6}/{@damage 1d8}) property, but does not have the {@itemProperty F||finesse} property. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can attempt to crush them under the weight of the {@item whip|PHB}. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or take {@damage 3d6} slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained}.

entries.name: Curse: All Devouring Sight
entries: While attuned to this weapon, your sight deteriorates rapidly. For each five days that pass, you gain a permanent −1 penalty to all {@skill Perception} checks made using your sight. When this penalty reaches −5, your eyes rot and melt out, leaving you permanently {@condition blinded} as two new eyes appear on the blade. However when you kill a creature of a CR equal to your level or greater, if the creature had eyes, your curse's penalty regresses by 1 (e.g., from −2 penalty to −1) to a minimum of 0.

The sword's curse is insidious: while you remain attuned to the weapon, you do not suffer the penalty to your {@skill Perception} checks, and you do not realize that your sight is worsening. The blade's influence makes you perceive the world in a clearer light. {@race Demidritch|SGttEH|Demidritches} are immune to this curse.

item.name: Python Bladewhip
entries: You have a +2 to attack and damage rolls made with both forms of this weapon.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: When you attune to this weapon, the cold, lifeless snake wraps around your forearm and bites your flesh, burying its head beneath it and inflicting {@damage 1d4} piercing damage. While attuned, you cannot be disarmed of this magical weapon. Ending the attunement causes the head to retract and the item to fall to the ground.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the bladewhip is a metallic {@item whip|PHB}. In its transformed state, the weapon solidifies by coagulating your blood to form a {@item rapier|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Attacks you make with the python bladewhip add an additional 5 feet to your reach, as well as when determining your reach for opportunity attacks with it. In addition, if you hit a creature twice in a turn with this weapon, the {@item whip|PHB|whip's} devouring hunger awakens and tears out more of its flesh, dealing an extra {@damage 4d4} slashing damage, and at the start of the target's next turn, it takes an extra {@damage 2d4} slashing damage.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: While transformed, you take {@damage 1} piercing damage at the start of each of your turns as the blade drains your blood to empower itself. In addition, you gain immunity to the {@condition poisoned} condition and to curses from spells (such as from {@spell bestow curse}). This {@item rapier|PHB} gains the Fireblood Poison property and is considered silvered.

entries.name: Fireblood Poison
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack using this blade, you can coat the wound with poison and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition poisoned} for the next minute as its innards start to boil. This can affect creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. This damage ignores resistance to fire damage.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the blade's Fireblood Poison for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Ravenous Gazer
entries: Acquiring forbidden knowledge always comes at a cost.
Any creature that attunes to this {@item glaive|PHB} is considered proficient with it. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the gazer is a {@item glaive|PHB}. In its transformed state, the gazer is a {@item glaive|PHB} which can be used as a spellcasting focus.

To transform this weapon, you must feed it your blood: each time you shift this weapon into its transformed state, or start your turn with the {@item glaive|PHB} in its transformed state, you take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage, which cannot be reduced in any way. This damage cannot break your {@status concentration}.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: While the {@item glaive|PHB} is in its transformed state, it grants you a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls, increases your spell save DC by 1, and gives you {@sense truesight} out to 30 feet.

item.name: Revelations
item.reqAttune: by a creature with a Strength of 15 or higher
entries: Made of an unknown metal that mixes blood and steel, this ghastly sword is studded with dozens of eyes from various creatures that stare hungrily at all who are confronted with it. Only a competent hunter can wield a weapon of such weight, but armed with it, they will never lose sight of their prey and will never be caught in an ambush. Such a dangerous weapon should only be used with the utmost caution.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While attuned to it, your sight improves as your vision starts echoing with that of the blade. While holding revelations, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can't be surprised
Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.
You are immune to being {@condition blinded}, as the sword absorbs the effect and closes two of its eyes instead, before regrowing them.

The curse ends early if you transform the weapon or if you fall {@condition unconscious}.

entries: While attuned to this weapon, your sight deteriorates rapidly. For each five days that pass, you gain a permanent −1 penalty to all {@skill Perception} checks made using your sight. When this penalty reaches −5, your eyes rot and melt out, leaving you permanently {@condition blinded} as two new eyes appear on the blade.

The sword's curse is insidious: while you remain attuned to the weapon, you do not suffer the penalty to your {@skill Perception} checks, and you do not realize that your sight is worsening. The blade's influence makes you perceive the world in a clearer light. {@race Demidritch|SGttEH|Demidritches} are immune to this curse.

item.name: Rifling Cleaver
entries: Rather than carrying separate firearms, which often become ineffective when beasts get close, many hunters conceal them within enormous {@item cleaver|SGttEH|cleavers} designed to rend flesh. Such creations of gunpowder and metal are aptly named rifling cleavers.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, it is is a large {@item cleaver|SGttEH}. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item rifle|SGttEH}). You can reload the {@item rifle|SGttEH}) even in its untransformed state.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: After making a melee weapon attack with this weapon, you can immediately use your bonus action to make a ranged weapon attack with the {@item rifle|SGttEH}) against a creature within range that is behind you and in a straight line with you and your first target. This shot extends the weapon, transforming it.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: Though unwieldy in melee, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the {@item rifle|SGttEH}). This attack uses your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier. The damage die for this attack is a {@dice d4}, and it deals bludgeoning damage. Your weapon then reverts to its untransformed state.

item.name: Sacrificial Brand, Drawn
entries: The carving, notorious among hunters and commonly dubbed the "Brand of Death," is a harbinger of an early demise for those burdened with its curse. Nevertheless, Steinhardt and Martyr Tulio—valiant souls undaunted by fear—etched the eldritch sigil into their own skin willingly. By bearing the ominous symbol, they sought to lure the beasts closer to them during the Hunt, granting their beleaguered brethren moments of respite amidst the chaos.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: During the three days of the Blood Moon, all evil-aligned creatures within Luyarnha gain advantage on {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} checks to locate creatures with this carving.

In addition, creatures bearing this carving begin to painfully bleed from it when hostile monsters within 300 feet of them are aware of their position. They cannot be surprised for the duration of the Blood Moon.

entries: The carving, notorious among hunters and commonly dubbed the "Brand of Death," is a harbinger of an early demise for those burdened with its curse. entries: During the three days of the Blood Moon, all evil-aligned creatures within Luyarnha gain advantage on {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} checks to locate creatures with this carving. If they are within 120 feet of a creature bearing the carving, they know their exact location and receive a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls against them.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: During the three days of the Blood Moon, all evil-aligned creatures within Luyarnha gain advantage on {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} checks to locate creatures with this carving. If they are within 300 feet of a creature bearing the carving, they know their exact location and receive a {@damage 1d4} bonus to attack and damage rolls against them.

In addition, creatures bearing this carving begin to painfully bleed from it when hostile monsters within 300 feet of them are aware of their position. They cannot be surprised for the duration of the Blood Moon.
