entries.name: Charged Shot:
entries: Once on each of your turns you can replace one of your cannon attacks with a charged shot. Instead of a regular attack, you let loose a ball of destruction and death. Each creature in a 120-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line in front of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Firearm save DC or take {@damage 3d12} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
You can use this property only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the property, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

item.name: Sanctified Partisan
entries: One of the most versatile weapons of the church.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the sanctified partisan is a {@item spear|PHB} and a {@item shield|PHB}. In its transformed state, the {@item spear|PHB} is sheathed by the {@item shield|PHB}, which retracts into a massive blade; the weapon becomes a {@item glaive|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Using this pair of weapons together requires the {@item spear|PHB} to be held in one hand and the {@item shield|PHB} in the other. When you are targeted by a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to deflect with the {@item shield|PHB}, gaining a +2 bonus to AC against that attack. If the attack misses, you can immediately make a single melee weapon attack with the {@item spear|PHB} as part of the same reaction.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: This {@item glaive|PHB} doesn't have the {@itemProperty H||heavy} property. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, as part of the attack, you can pierce the target, transform the weapon, and only pull out the {@item spear|PHB}. The {@item shield|PHB} remains in the target's body, impaling it. An impaled creature takes {@damage 1d4} slashing damage at the start of each of its turns, and its speed is reduced by 15 feet. To remove the {@item shield|PHB}, the impaled target can use its action to make a {@dc 12} Strength check. On a success, the {@item shield|PHB} is removed and falls at the target's feet. If you are within 5 feet of the {@item shield|PHB}, you can use a bonus action to retrieve and don it.

item.name: Scatter Bullets (10)
entries: {@note See {@item Scatter Bullet|SGttEH}.}

item.name: Second Carving, Drawn
entries: The Second Carving—the Voice of Creation, said to originate from the ancient scriptures of a lost civilization—manifests the omnipotence of He who spoke it into being. A power that reflects the terror of what lies beyond, as this single word holds the potential to unravel reality in a myriad of ways.

No mortal should be given this power of creation, their hubris begetting suffering and tyranny. The last possessor of this carving, the Godless King, proclaimed himself divine, turning the world into hell, for it meant that he could rule over its ashes as a god.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You understand {@language Celestial} and {@language Deep Speech}. Further, you are imbued with righteous power and gain the ability to cast spells. Constitution or Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells, whichever is higher. You can use each of the following decrees once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Each decree only requires the verbal component of the spell.

items.name: Decree of Obedience
entries: You force the heretic to kneel and worship. You can cast the {@spell command} spell, using only the grovel command.

items.name: Decree of Power
entries: You unleash destructive might. You can cast the {@spell bless} spell on willing creatures. When a creature rolls a 1 on the {@dice d4} as part of this spell, it can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1. Creatures under the effect of the spell also take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage (which cannot be reduced) at the start of each of their turns.

items.name: Decree of Blood
entries: You harangue your soldiers to endure. You can cast the {@spell healing word} spell on a willing creature. Until the end of the target's next turn, it gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, but each time it takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the same type.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: You can speak {@language Celestial} and {@language Deep Speech}.

entries.name: Aegis of the Almighty
entries: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Each day at dawn, you can choose one creature that you can see. For the next 24 hours, it has resistance to radiant damage as long as it remains within 10 feet of you and you are conscious.
In addition, you can now use each of your decrees a number of times equal to your Constitution or Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Aegis of the Almighty
entries: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Friendly creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you have resistance to radiant damage while you are conscious.
In addition, you can amplify the effect of your decrees. When you do so, you expend two uses instead of one.

items.name: Improved Decree of Obedience
entries: When you cast {@spell command} with this decree, you can target a number of creatures of your choice you can see within range equal to your Constitution or Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher.

items.name: Improved Decree of Power
entries: When you cast {@spell bless} with this decree, creatures under the effect of the spell gain an additional action on each of their turns. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action. The damage they take at the start of their turn increases to {@damage 2d4}.

items.name: Improved Decree of Blood
entries: When you cast {@spell healing word} with this decree, it is cast at 7th level. Until the end of the target's next turn, it gains a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls, but each time it takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 2d4} damage of the same type.

item.name: Second Carving, Tattooed
entries: The Second Carving—the Voice of Creation, said to originate from the ancient scriptures of a lost civilization—manifests the omnipotence of He who spoke it into being. A power that reflects the terror of what lies beyond, as this single word holds the potential to unravel reality in a myriad of ways.

No mortal should be given this power of creation, their hubris begetting suffering and tyranny. The last possessor of this carving, the Godless King, proclaimed himself divine, turning the world into hell, for it meant that he could rule over its ashes as a god.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You understand {@language Celestial} and {@language Deep Speech}. Further, you are imbued with righteous power and gain the ability to cast spells. Constitution or Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells, whichever is higher. You can use each of the following decrees once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Each decree only requires the verbal component of the spell.

items.name: Decree of Obedience
entries: You force the heretic to kneel and worship. You can cast the {@spell command} spell, using only the grovel command.

items.name: Decree of Power
entries: You unleash destructive might. You can cast the {@spell bless} spell on willing creatures. When a creature rolls a 1 on the {@dice d4} as part of this spell, it can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1. Creatures under the effect of the spell also take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage (which cannot be reduced) at the start of each of their turns.

items.name: Decree of Blood
entries: You harangue your soldiers to endure. You can cast the {@spell healing word} spell on a willing creature. Until the end of the target's next turn, it gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, but each time it takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the same type.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: You can speak {@language Celestial} and {@language Deep Speech}.

entries.name: Aegis of the Almighty
entries: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Each day at dawn, you can choose one creature that you can see. For the next 24 hours, it has resistance to radiant damage as long as it remains within 10 feet of you and you are conscious.
In addition, you can now use each of your decrees a number of times equal to your Constitution or Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

item.name: Serpent Bladewhip
entries: You have a +1 to attack and damage rolls made with both forms of this weapon.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: When you attune to this weapon, the cold, lifeless snake wraps around your forearm and bites your flesh, burying its head beneath it and inflicting {@damage 1d4} piercing damage. While attuned, you cannot be disarmed of this magical weapon. Ending the attunement causes the head to retract and the item to fall to the ground.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the bladewhip is a metallic {@item whip|PHB}. In its transformed state, the weapon solidifies by coagulating your blood to form a {@item rapier|PHB}.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: Attacks you make with the serpent bladewhip add an additional 5 feet to your reach, as well as when determining your reach for {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with it. In addition, if you hit a creature twice in a turn with this weapon, the whip's devouring hunger awakens and tears out more of its flesh, dealing an extra {@damage 2d4} slashing damage.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: While transformed, you take {@damage 1} piercing damage at the start of each of your turns as the blade drains your blood to empower itself. This {@item rapier|PHB} gains the Fireblood Poison property and is considered silvered.

entries.name: Fireblood Poison
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack using this blade, you can coat the wound with poison and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition poisoned} for the next minute as its innards start to boil. This can affect creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. This damage ignores resistance to fire damage.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the blade's Fireblood Poison for the next 24 hours.

item.name: Shard of Moonlight
entries: This weapon is the flesh of a Great One carved away in pain and fashioned into a blade. The Shard of Moonlight is the reason the {@card Shattered Moon|Eldritch Moons Deck|SGttEH} exists and the Devouring Moon is no more. He who wields the blade is overwhelmed by hope, however misguided it might be...
While attuned to this weapon, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with {@item greatsword|PHB|greatswords} and {@item longsword|PHB|longswords}.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and the blade deals an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage on a hit.
You have advantage on Wisdom saving throws, except those made to resist madness.
You can use this shard as a spellcasting focus.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The Shard of Moonlight is a sentient weapon, with the same personality as the Great One whose flesh it was carved from. The weapon sporadically communicates telepathically with its wielder through images and sounds, though it doesn't speak.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the blade is a metallic {@item longsword|PHB} that absorbs light. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item greatsword|PHB} that pulses with lunar energy. In both states, this weapon has the {@itemProperty L||light} property.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: The blade seems to guide your strikes. Once on each of your turns when you make an attack with the shard, you can immediately make a second attack (no action required). It has the Void Absorption property.

entries.name: Void Absorption
entries: The void that fills the blade is capable of absorbing magic. While holding the untransformed shard, you can use your reaction to absorb a spell that is targeting you, including spells with an area of effect. The absorbed spell's effect is canceled, and the spell's energy—not the spell itself—is stored in the shard in the form of charges. The number of charges gained is equivalent to the level of the spell when it was cast (minimum of 1 for cantrips). The shard can absorb and store up to 10 charges. If the shard doesn't have enough empty charges for a spell, it fails to absorb it. The blade regains all charges each time the moon changes.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: To transform this blade, you must use a bonus action while under direct moonlight. The transformation lasts for 1 minute, or until you end it early as a bonus action. When it transforms, you can expend the charges stored within the blade, and when the blade loses all charges, the transformation ends. While the blade is transformed, the extra radiant damage it deals on a hit increases from {@damage 1d6} to {@damage 2d6}.
Each time you make an attack in the transformed state, you can expend a number of charges to create special effects:

items.name: Revealing Glow
entries: As part of making an attack, you can expend 1 charge to empower the shard. On a hit, it deals an extra {@damage 1d12} radiant damage, and until the start of your next turn, the target sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. While affected by the light, attack rolls against the target have advantage if the attacker can see them, and the affected target can't turn {@condition invisible}.

items.name: Transient Moonlight
entries: As part of making an attack, you can expend 2 charges to release a wave of moonlight where the shard slashes, creating a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line of moonlight in front of you. A creature in the path of the moonlight must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d12} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Lunar Explosion
entries: Instead of making an attack, you can expend 3 charges to raise the shard upward and release a burst of moonlight energy. Each creature within 30 feet of you must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d12} radiant damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. If a creature falls {@condition prone} within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to immediately make a melee weapon attack against them with the shard.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, it's a {@item stick|SGttEH}. In its transformed state, you break it over your knee and it's two {@item stick|SGttEH|sticks}. The {@item stick|SGttEH} may only return to its untransformed state over the course of an hour as you use glue and bandages to bind the two pieces back together and wait for it to cure. It has the Ill Advised Weapon property.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: It's a {@item stick|SGttEH}, has the {@itemProperty L||light} property, and if you hit with it, it deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: It's two {@item stick|SGttEH|sticks}, each held in a hand. A hit with either {@item stick|SGttEH} deals 1 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage (minimum of 0).

entries.name: Ill Advised Weapon
entries: When you attack with the {@item stick|SGttEH}, if you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20}, it is destroyed and unusable. If this occurs during the transformed state of the {@item stick|SGttEH}, the {@item stick|SGttEH} not used in the attack remains, but cannot be untransformed. If the remaining {@item stick|SGttEH} also is destroyed by this property, you no longer have a {@item stick|SGttEH}.

item.name: Superior Holy Tonic
entries: The mostly-clear tonic in this vial is slightly milky and sparkles when light shines through. It was originally created by a secretive branch of the Radiant Church.
When you drink this tonic, you regain {@dice 8d4 + 8} hit points and are cured of all diseases you currently suffer from.

entries.name: Side Effects
entries: Depending on the lore your game implements, the holy tonic can have one or more of the following side effects. These effects are hidden from player characters and no magic can reveal them.

items: If you fall {@condition unconscious} within {@dice 1d12} minutes after drinking the holy tonic, you must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table long-term madness|SGttEH} when you regain consciousness.

1 hour after you drink the holy tonic, you hear whispering voices urging you toward violence and chaos. You must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on any {@skill Persuasion} checks for the next {@dice 1d4} hours. Additionally, for the duration, you are compelled to act on aggressive impulses as determined by the GM.
24 hours after you drink the holy tonic, you must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}.

24 hours after you drink the holy tonic, you must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or crave more holy tonic. For the next {@dice 1d4} hours, you desperately search for a holy tonic and drink the first one you find. If you do not drink one within this time, you gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} and the craving goes away.

Each subsequent holy tonic you drink in a 7-day period increases the DCs for the saving throws you must make by 1. Each three holy tonics you drink in a 7-day period increases any {@condition exhaustion} levels the tonic causes by 1.

If you fail five Wisdom saving throws caused by a holy tonic within a 7-day period, a curse fully takes hold. You undergo a horrifying transformation into a monstrous beast, losing control of your actions and permanently becoming a beast or monstrosity of the GM's choice under their control.

item.name: Sword of the Radiant Watcher
entries: The Sword of the Radiant Watcher is an ancient weapon, meant to contain two entities bound into eternal hatred. One was a hunter and one was a beast, though no one knows which aspect of the blade they were bound to.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: This sentient weapon has two distinct personalities, each linked to its corresponding transformed state. The Angelic personality (alignment: lawful good) is protective and nurturing, while the Hateful personality (alignment: chaotic evil) is cunning and ruthless. The weapon has an Intelligence of {@ability int 14}, a Wisdom of {@ability wis 12}, and a Charisma of {@ability cha 17}. It has hearing and {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet. The dominant personality may attempt to influence the wielder's actions, particularly when it comes to matters of morality or strategy. However, the sword cannot force its wielder to act against their will. The sword communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand {@language Common} and {@language Deep Speech}.

As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon by letting hatred or hope overwhelm you. In both states, the weapon is a {@item longsword|PHB}. When the weapon's form changes, so too does its dominant personality.

The two personalities within the Sword of the Radiant Watcher are in constant struggle for dominance. When the wielder attempts to switch the weapon's forms, they must exert their force of will to do so, making a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a success, the sword changes form, and on a failure, it stubbornly refuses to do so until the start of your next turn, at which point you can attempt to switch the weapon's forms again.

entries.name: Untransformed: Light Form
entries: The Angelic personality is dominant and the sword deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage on a hit.

entries.name: Curse of Light
entries: When you hit a creature with this sword, you can bind the target to your light (no action required). For the next minute, you are under the effect of the {@spell sanctuary} spell, but only the bound target must make the saving throw. This effect ends as normal if you take an action that would break it but returns at the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Retribution of Light
entries: When a target is under the effect of the Curse of Light, as a bonus action, you can bolster up to four creatures of your choice that can hear you within 30 feet for the duration of the curse. While bolstered, they have advantage on their first attack roll against the target each turn, and if the attack hits, it deals extra damage equal to their proficiency bonus of the damage type they dealt. This property of the weapon can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

entries.name: Transformed: Shadow Form
entries: The Hateful personality is dominant and the sword deals an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Shadow Chain
entries: When you hit a creature with this sword, you can tether the target to you with a chain of shadowy energy (no action required). While tethered, the creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and neither you nor the creature can willingly move or teleport more than 30 feet away from each other. The tether lasts for 1 minute, until you use this property on another creature, if you start your turn more than 30 feet away from the target, or end the tether as a bonus action.

entries.name: Shadow Consumption
entries: While tethered to a creature with your Shadow Chain, once on each of your turns when you hit the target with this weapon, you can inflict an extra {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. This property of the weapon can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

entries.name: Abhorrent Existence
entries: The sentient entities within the sword are antithetical to each other, and no creature can withstand their presence at once, which is why the blade was sealed in such a way. Once on each of your turns, if both forms of the sword damage the same creature in a single turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}.

In addition, if you deal necrotic damage with the shadow form of sword while the Curse of Light is in effect; or oppositely, if you deal radiant damage with the light form of the sword while the Shadow Chain is in effect, the effect ends and detonates. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} radiant damage and {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage as the antithetical energies resonate and self-destruct. You have advantage on this saving throw.

item.name: Third Carving, Drawn
entries: The Third Carving is Mikha'el—The Left Hand of Creation, the herald of punishment.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: When you roll initiative, you can choose to let the carving consume you for 1 minute (no action required). You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Wings of Judgement
entries: Wings sprout on your back, granting you a flying speed of 30 feet. You can only use this speed to move towards a hostile creature that you can see.

items.name: Seraphic Blade
entries: A blade of eldritch—or perhaps divine—energy appears in your hand. This blade is a magic weapon that has the {@itemProperty F||finesse} property and deals {@damage 1d6} fire and {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on a hit.
Once you use this carving, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Third Carving, Scarified
entries: The Third Carving is Mikha'el—The Left Hand of Creation, the herald of punishment.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: When you roll initiative, you can choose to let the carving consume you for 1 minute (no action required). You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Wings of Judgement

items.name: Seraphic Blade
entries: A blade of eldritch—or perhaps divine—energy appears in your hand. This blade is a magic weapon that has the {@itemProperty F||finesse} property and deals {@damage 1d6} fire and {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on a hit.
Once you use this carving, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: When you let the carving consume you, you instead gain the following improved benefits for the duration:

items.name: Wings of Judgement
entries: Wings sprout on your back, granting you a flying speed of 60 feet. You can only use this speed to move towards a hostile creature that you can see.

items.name: Righteous Punishment
entries: Creatures that raise their hand against you—a chosen one—must be punished. When you take damage from a creature you can see within 120 feet, you can use your reaction to emit a psychic shockwave in its direction. The attacking creature must make an Intelligence saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, it takes psychic damage equal to your character level. On a success, it takes half as much damage. As part of the same reaction, you can cause a creature that failed its saving throw to be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. Once you {@condition stunned|PHB|stun} a creature in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Seraphic Blade
entries: A blade of eldritch—or perhaps divine—energy appears in your hand. This blade is a magic weapon that has the finesse and thrown (range 60/120) properties, and it deals {@damage 1d8} fire and {@damage 1d8} psychic damage on a hit. Each time you throw the blade, it flies back to your hand after the attack.

Alternatively, you can cause the blade to fuse with a nonmagical weapon you are holding. If you do so, for the duration, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire and {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: The carving imbues you, permanently granting you the benefits of the Tattooed carving. When you use your Righteous Punishment to {@condition stunned|PHB|stun} a creature, you can do so again after 1 minute. Finally, your Seraphic Blade can fuse with a magical weapon that you are holding.

entries: The Third Carving is Mikha'el—The Left Hand of Creation, the herald of punishment.

Alternatively, you can cause the blade to fuse with a nonmagical weapon you are holding. If you do so, for the duration, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire and {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on a hit.

item.name: Thirsting pe Sanguine
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which deals an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage on a hit. When you hit a creature with blood with this weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.
You are immune to poison and necrotic damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.
You know the exact location of any creature with blood within a 30-foot radius, even if they are {@condition invisible} or on the Ethereal plane.

entries: The weapon has the Lifestealing property.

entries.name: Lifestealing
entries: In dire situations, the pe grants you the power to take the life of others. If you are reduced to one-quarter of your hit points or fewer, you can immediately use this property (no action required). Until the end of your next turn, whenever you deal damage using this weapon, you regain hit points equal to the damage dealt. Once this property of the weapon has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the blade is a vile {@item longsword|PHB} glowing with echoes of blood. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item greatsword|PHB} with an even more nefarious aspect.

To transform this weapon, you must feed it blood. Each time you deal damage with this weapon to a creature that possesses blood, the pe gains 1 charge. The pe can hold up to 6 charges. Each charge lasts for 1 minute or until it is consumed. If this weapon has 1 or more charges, you can use your bonus action to transform it.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: You gain a {@dice 1d12} bonus to attack rolls you make with this weapon against creatures that are at their hit point maximum. In addition, the weapon has the Blood Shield property.

entries.name: Blood Shield
entries: The pe forms a barrier of blood around you with the blood it has absorbed. You gain a +1 bonus to AC for each 2 charges within the pe.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: You gain a {@dice 1d6} bonus to attack rolls you make with this weapon against creatures that are below their hit point maximum. In this form, the pe sanguine consumes 1 charge at the end of each of your turns, unless you've expended 1 or more charges that turn. It reverts back to its untransformed state if it loses all charges.
When you hit a creature with an attack using the pe, you can expend 1 or more charges to unleash the blood accumulated in the blade:

items.name: 1 Charge
entries: You heal a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage you dealt.

items.name: 2 Charges
entries: You deal an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and heal a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage you dealt.

items.name: 3 Charges
entries: The target becomes bound in blood and must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

items.name: 4 Charges
entries: Blood covers the creature's face and chokes it. The creature must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

item.name: Torture Tools
entries: This satchel contains various small implements that can bludgeon, cut, and pierce in ways designed to maximize pain. Meant to extract the truth, many use these tools with far more nefarious intentions. Proficiency with these tools grants the following benefits:

entries.name: Exhaustion
entries: Using these tools for 1 hour on a {@condition restrained} creature causes them to gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}, after which you must make a Dexterity (torture tools) check. The DC is equal to 20 − the creature's Constitution modifier. On a failure, the creature takes 10 points of your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

entries.name: Intimidation
entries: When you make an {@skill Intimidation} check against a creature whom you used these tools against, you gain a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus + twice the level of {@condition exhaustion} the creature has.

item.name: Tree Stride Amulet
entries: While wearing it, you can use an action to expend one charge and cast the {@spell tree stride} spell from it. You can also bring along one creature of your size or smaller when you move between trees using that spell. You must be {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} the creature to do so.
This amulet has 3 charges, and regains 1 expended charge daily at dawn.

item.name: Unbound pe Solaire
entries: The method to create the pe Solaire is a tight-lipped secret, involving harnessing the power of the sun, a method that only devout followers of the Radiant One can grasp. As time went on, the sun faded from the skies of Luyarnha, replaced by a never ending night, and so, the creation of this weapon became impossible. This pe Solaire was bathed in the blood of the sun, unleashing its potential.
While attuned to this weapon, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with {@item greatsword|PHB|greatswords} and {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords}.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage on a hit. When you hit an aberration or undead with it, the extra radiant damage increases to {@damage 2d8}.
You have advantage on saving throws against madness.

entries: The weapon's blade emits bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The light is sunlight. You can summon or extinguish the light at will (no action required). Each creature of your choice in the light has resistance to radiant damage. This weapon has the Deflective Light property.

entries.name: Deflective Light
entries: When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to cause a burst of sunlight to flare before the attacker, imposing disadvantage on the attack roll and transforming the weapon. An attacker that can't be {@condition blinded} is immune to this property.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the blade is a metallic {@item greatsword|PHB} glowing with light. In its transformed state, the weapon is two {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords} emitting the same glow.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: While wielding this {@item greatsword|PHB}, your senses are pushed to their limit. You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws. In addition, the weapon has the Light of Judgment property.

entries.name: Light of Judgment
entries: As a bonus action, you can unleash judgment upon the heretics. The blade's light is summoned for the next minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious} or transform the weapon. You and all hostile creatures within the bright light immediately take {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. In addition, for the duration, you deal an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage whenever you damage a creature with the pe, and radiant damage you deal ignores resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: When you engage in {@action two-weapon fighting} with these {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords}, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack. In addition, this weapon gains the Sunscorch property.

entries.name: Sunscorch
entries: Whenever you hit a creature two times in a turn with these {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords}, the accumulated solar energy detonates. Each creature in a 15-foot radius must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Uncharged Claw
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you have resistance to lightning damage.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, if you've taken lightning damage or spent a hit die since the start of your last turn, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the claw is a sinewy leather gauntlet, made from the muscle and hide of a galvanized prowler. In its transformed state, the claw surges with electrical energy, merging with its wearer's forearm and turning into a monstrous claw.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: The bestial hide feeds off of you in exchange for power; you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, this gauntlet devours your life force. When you hit with a melee attack, you can spend a hit die to deal an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

The gauntlet has 2 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you take lighting or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge to instead take no damage and regain 1 hit die.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: The gauntlet merges with your form, turning your hand into an aberrant claw that you cannot be disarmed of. This claw changes the damage of your unarmed strikes to {@damage 1d8}, the damage type to slashing, and you can use your Dexterity or Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls made with it.
In addition, when you hit with a melee attack using this claw, you can spend a hit die to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.
The claw is too unwieldy to use for delicate handling, such as activating intricate mechanisms (like the trigger of a firearm) or picking locks with {@item thieves' tools|PHB}.

item.name: Unstable Crumbler
entries: While holding this weapon, your attacks and spells deal double damage to structures, and fire damage you take is reduced by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the crumbler is a roaring {@item cannon|SGttEH} with smoke coming out of its mouth. In its transformed state, the handle extends, turning the {@item cannon|SGttEH} into a highly unstable and destructive {@item maul|PHB}. As part of this bonus action, you can do the following:

items: When transforming the {@item cannon|SGttEH} into a {@item maul|PHB}, you can shoot at your feet, even if the {@item cannon|SGttEH} isn't loaded, using the deflagration to propel yourself and jump up to 30 feet in any direction. This jump doesn't cost you any movement.

When transforming the {@item maul|PHB} into a {@item cannon|SGttEH}, you can reload the {@item cannon|SGttEH} and retain its unstable force. If you load it in this way, the next time you hit with an attack with the {@item cannon|SGttEH} attack on your turn, it will push you back 30 feet in a straight line.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: The unstable crumbler heats up cannonballs, transforming them into infernal ammunition. Whenever you roll a 15 or higher on the {@dice d20} when making an attack roll with this weapon, the {@item cannonball|SGttEH} becomes overheated and explodes on impact. When the {@item cannonball|SGttEH} explodes in this way, it is considered an {@item explosive cannonball|SGttEH}.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: Whenever you roll a 18 or higher on the {@dice d20} while making an attack roll with this weapon, the {@item maul|PHB|maul's} head detonates, causing an effect that acts as the {@spell fireball} spell ({@dc 15}) centered on the target. If you succeed on this saving throw, you take no damage.

item.name: White Fungic Tea
entries: The aroma and appearance of this tea are undeniably repulsive, with seemingly still-living organisms squirming within it. However, for those who can stomach it, the tea offers impressive soothing properties.

Known for temporarily alleviating the effects of madness, the darker the tea, the more potent and challenging to brew. Once ingested, the afflicted individual is relieved of the affected madness for 1 hour or until the madness ends, whichever is shorter.

However, upon swallowing the tea, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC listed in the table below. On a failure, you can't stomach the appalling taste, regurgitate the tea, and don't gain the benefits.
The tea is made in kettles that can pour up to {@dice 2d4} cups.

items.name: Affected Madness:
entries: One {@table short-term madness|SGttEH|short-term}

item.name: Yellow Fungic Tea
entries: The aroma and appearance of this tea are undeniably repulsive, with seemingly still-living organisms squirming within it. However, for those who can stomach it, the tea offers impressive soothing properties.

Known for temporarily alleviating the effects of madness, the darker the tea, the more potent and challenging to brew. Once ingested, the afflicted individual is relieved of the affected madness for 1 hour or until the madness ends, whichever is shorter.

However, upon swallowing the tea, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC listed in the table below. On a failure, you can't stomach the appalling taste, regurgitate the tea, and don't gain the benefits.
The tea is made in kettles that can pour up to {@dice 2d4} cups.

items.name: Affected Madness:
entries: All {@table short-term madness|SGttEH|short-term}; one {@table long-term madness|SGttEH|long-term}

item.name: pe Sanguine
entries: This sword, formed of coagulated blood, is a dark red, nearly black color. It is warm to the touch and emits a vigorous pulse. According to legend, the blade has a will of its own and grows stronger by consuming the blood of its victims. The sword may even make its master immortal, but at a heavy cost.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which deals an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the blade is a vile {@item longsword|PHB} glowing with echoes of blood. In its transformed state, the weapon is a {@item greatsword|PHB} with an even more nefarious aspect.

To transform this weapon, you must feed it blood. Each time you deal damage with this weapon to a creature that possesses blood, the pe gains 1 charge. The pe can hold up to 4 charges. Each charge lasts for 1 minute or until it is consumed. If this weapon has 1 or more charges, you can use your bonus action to transform it.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: You gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to attack rolls you make with this weapon against creatures that have more than half their hit points.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: You gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to attack rolls you make with this weapon against creatures that are bloodied (half of its hit points or fewer). In this form, the pe sanguine consumes 1 charge at the end of each of your turns, unless you've expended 1 or more charges that turn. It reverts back to its untransformed state if it loses all charges.
When you hit a creature with an attack using the pe, you can expend 1 or more charges to unleash the blood accumulated in the blade:

items.name: 1 Charge
entries: You heal a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage you dealt.

items.name: 2 Charges
entries: You deal an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and heal a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage you dealt.

items.name: 3 Charges
entries: The target becomes bound in blood and must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

items.name: 4 Charges
entries: Blood covers the creature's face and chokes it. The creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

item.name: pe Solaire
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with {@item greatsword|PHB|greatswords} and {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords}.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which deals an extra {@damage 1d4} radiant damage on a hit. When you hit an aberration or undead with it, the extra radiant damage increases to {@damage 2d4}.

entries: The weapon's blade emits bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can summon or extinguish the light at will (no action required). This weapon has the Deflective Light property.

entries.name: Deflective Light
entries: When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to cause a burst of sunlight to flare before the attacker, imposing disadvantage on the attack roll and transforming the weapon. An attacker that can't be {@condition blinded} is immune to this property. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

entries.name: Trick Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch between the transformed and untransformed states of this weapon. In its untransformed state, the blade is a metallic {@item greatsword|PHB} glowing with light. In its transformed state, the weapon is two {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords} emitting the same glow.

entries.name: Untransformed
entries: While wielding this {@item greatsword|PHB}, your reflexes are enhanced. You gain a +1 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.

entries.name: Transformed
entries: When you engage in {@action two-weapon fighting} with these {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords}, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack. In addition, this weapon gains the Brightburn property.

entries.name: Brightburn
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature two times with these {@item shortsword|PHB|shortswords}, the accumulated solar energy singes them. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

itemGroup.name: Curse of Moon-Blood
entries: During the initial days of the scourge, not all the afflicted turned to beasts. Most of them went mad, some unlucky few were devoured, but the hunger of those blood-thirsty enough to consume the flesh of both man and beast irreversibly twisted their soul and body. These cannibals did what they had to in order to survive, but became cursed, turning into the first of the crimson beasts, also known as the Moon-Blooded. The fate of a Moon-Blooded was to die an atrocious death, worthy of the weight of their sins.

Such atrocities wouldn't go unnoticed, and one day all those who contracted this curse were found dead, their mangled corpses half buried within the ground. Who committed such an act? No one knows. In the ensuing days, those privy to the powers of eldritch carvings were quick to notice the pattern amidst the corpses, Martyr Tulio first among them.

This eldritch rune engraved upon one's flesh allows the control of the curse it was created from. The host can shape their blood into weapons and use it to deflect deadly blows. Though powerful, if too much blood is spilled, the ancient curse awakens anew, devouring life and unleashing the terrifying crimson beast of old.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: As a bonus action, you unleash the powers held within the carving, transforming into a crimson beast. You take necrotic damage equal to one roll of your hit die, which cannot be reduced in any way, and suffer this damage again for each minute you remain transformed. This transformation ends early if you fall unconscious or end it as a bonus action. The blood you lose shapes itself into one of the following powers:

items.name: Barbed Tail
entries: A bloody tail erupts from your lower spine. As part of transforming and on subsequent turns as a bonus action, you can make a melee weapon attack with it. The tail is considered a simple melee weapon you are proficient with, has the finesse and reach properties, and deals {@damage 1d8} magical piercing damage on a hit.

items.name: Razor Claws
entries: Your hands grow sharp claws that you can climb and kill with. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and your unarmed strikes deal an extra {@damage 1d6} magical slashing damage.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: The carving's power protects your body when the situation is most dire. While attuned to this item, your AC increases by 2 while you are below half your hit point maximum.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: When you choose to transform into a crimson beast, the powers you gain access to are enhanced, replacing the Drawn powers. Choose one of the following:

items.name: Blood Wings
entries: You sprout wings from your back, giving you a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

items.name: Barbed Tail
entries: A bloody tail erupts from your lower spine. As part of transforming and on subsequent turns as a bonus action, you can make a melee weapon attack with it. The tail is considered a simple melee weapon you are proficient with, it has the finesse and reach properties, and deals {@damage 3d8} magical piercing damage on a hit.

items.name: Razor Claws
entries: Your hands grow sharp claws that you can climb and kill with. You gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed, and your unarmed strikes deal an extra {@damage 2d6} magical slashing damage.

In addition, when you are reduced to 0 hit points, you lose control of yourself as your blood takes a life of its own and you go berserk. You regain 1 hit point and gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your hit point maximum. While berserk, you gain all the abilities of your crimson beast transformation and on each of your turns, you attack the nearest creature you can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, you attack an object, with preference for an object smaller than yourself. Once you go berserk, you stay in that state for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. When it ends, you immediately drop to 0 hit points, are dying, and have 2 failed death saving throws. After you've gone berserk, you lose all the abilities from the eldritch carving for 1 week.
items: Curse of Moon-Blood, Drawn|SGttEH
Curse of Moon-Blood, Tattooed|SGttEH
Curse of Moon-Blood, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: First Carving
entries: The original carving, The Right Hand of Creation, is the first sign the Old Ones left behind when devoted worshipers implored for divine help against the Scourge. The price for such power is still being paid to this day.
None have seen the full power of this carving, as the original is sealed deep within the earth, guarded by a sin left behind by the Radiant Church.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: At the end of a long rest, you gain the effect of a {@spell sanctuary} spell that lasts until the start of your next long rest (the spell can end early as normal). The saving throw DC for the spell equals 8 + your Constitution or Wisdom modifier (whichever is higher) + your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Wings of Salvation
entries: In addition, when a willing creature you can see within 60 feet of you is targeted by an attack roll or forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to give them wings to fly out of danger. A pair of angelic wings sprout on their back, which carries them in a straight line to you, where they land in an unoccupied space next to you. This can potentially cause the harmful effect to miss if the creature leaves the range of the effect. The wings then vanish. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: At the end of a long rest, you gain the effect of the {@spell death ward} spell cast on yourself.

In addition, you can use Wings of Salvation twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Further, when you use Wings of Salvation, as part of the reaction, you can cast {@spell warding bond} on the target. You do not need to provide the spell slot or material components for the spell, but you need to {@status concentration|PHB|concentrate} on this spell to maintain it.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: You can use Wings of Salvation a number of times equal to Constitution or Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Devour Sin
entries: Upon death, your body is immediately struck by the {@spell true resurrection} spell. Alternatively, if a creature dies while under the effect of {@spell warding bond} cast through your Wings of Salvation, the creature is affected by {@spell true resurrection}. Once Devour Sin grants its effects, the carving loses all power for 3 days.

items: First Carving, Drawn|SGttEH
First Carving, Tattooed|SGttEH
First Carving, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Fungic Tea
entries: The aroma and appearance of this tea are undeniably repulsive, with seemingly still-living organisms squirming within it. However, for those who can stomach it, the tea offers impressive soothing properties.

Known for temporarily alleviating the effects of madness, the darker the tea, the more potent and challenging to brew. Once ingested, the afflicted individual is relieved of the affected madness for 1 hour or until the madness ends, whichever is shorter.

However, upon swallowing the tea, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC listed in the table below. On a failure, you can't stomach the appalling taste, regurgitate the tea, and don't gain the benefits.
The tea is made in kettles that can pour up to {@dice 2d4} cups.
items: White Fungic Tea|SGttEH
Yellow Fungic Tea|SGttEH
Blue Fungic Tea|SGttEH
Black Fungic Tea|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Holy Tonic (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item Holy Tonic}}.
The mostly-clear tonic in this vial is slightly milky and sparkles when light shines through. It was originally created by a secretive branch of the Radiant Church.
When you drink this tonic, you regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points and are cured of all diseases you currently suffer from.

entries.name: Side Effects
entries: Depending on the lore your game implements, the holy tonic can have one or more of the following side effects. These effects are hidden from player characters and no magic can reveal them.

items: If you fall {@condition unconscious} within {@dice 1d12} minutes after drinking the holy tonic, you must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table long-term madness|SGttEH} when you regain consciousness.

1 hour after you drink the holy tonic, you hear whispering voices urging you toward violence and chaos. You must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on any {@skill Persuasion} checks for the next {@dice 1d4} hours. Additionally, for the duration, you are compelled to act on aggressive impulses as determined by the GM.
24 hours after you drink the holy tonic, you must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}.

24 hours after you drink the holy tonic, you must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or crave more holy tonic. For the next {@dice 1d4} hours, you desperately search for a holy tonic and drink the first one you find. If you do not drink one within this time, you gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} and the craving goes away.

Each subsequent holy tonic you drink in a 7-day period increases the DCs for the saving throws you must make by 1. Each three holy tonics you drink in a 7-day period increases any {@condition exhaustion} levels the tonic causes by 1.

If you fail five Wisdom saving throws caused by a holy tonic within a 7-day period, a curse fully takes hold. You undergo a horrifying transformation into a monstrous beast, losing control of your actions and permanently becoming a beast or monstrosity of the GM's choice under their control.

entries.name: GM Note:
entries: Alternatively the holy tonic can restore {@dice 6d4+6} or {@dice 8d4+8} hit points.

items: Holy Tonic|SGttEH
Greater Holy Tonic|SGttEH
Superior Holy Tonic|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Leaded Blood
entries: Though the original carving has been lost to time, the Scions have manufactured enough perfect replicas to make this one of the most widely distributed eldritch carvings, having shared them with the Church and the hunters in an apparent selfless effort to aid against the Scourge. The most recent manikins of the Scions all come with this carving drawn on their porcelain skin, as most cannot handle a deeper eldritch knowledge.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You can convert your blood into bullets. As a bonus action, you can sacrifice 3 hit points to generate 3 blood bullets. These bullets function as regular {@item lead bullet|SGttEH|lead bullets}. You can only ever have 3 blood bullets present at once; any additional bullets you create immediately liquefy. The bullets last until they're used or until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: You can convert your blood into bullets. As a bonus action, you can sacrifice 3 hit points to generate 5 blood bullets. These bullets function as regular {@item lead bullet|SGttEH|lead bullets}. You can only ever have 5 blood bullets present at once; any additional bullets you create immediately liquefy. The bullets last until they're used or until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: You can convert your blood into bullets. As a bonus action, you can sacrifice 3 hit points to generate 10 blood bullets or a blood cannonball. These function as their regular counterparts. You can only ever have 10 blood bullets or a blood cannonball present at once; any additional bullets or cannonballs you create immediately liquefy. The bullets last until they're used or until you finish a short or long rest.

items: Leaded Blood, Drawn|SGttEH
Leaded Blood, Tattooed|SGttEH
Leaded Blood, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Lightning Scion
entries: The Lightning Scion carving was unearthed by a group of arcanists delving into the mysteries of forlorn artifacts. The profound connection between electrical energy and life was unveiled before them, propelling a surge of never-before-seen technological advancements. Thus began the magnificence of the once humble faction that would come to be known as the Scions. The carving embodies the raw power that serves as the bedrock of the Scions, infusing its possessor with the force of lightning. This allows them to traverse and assail with speed beyond mortal perception, or alternatively, employ the electricity to reanimate corpses through careful stimulation of the marrow.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage.

In addition, as a bonus action, you can teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. This carving can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: The distance you can teleport with this carving increases to 30 feet. After you teleport, your body becomes overcharged with electricity, and the next attack you make before the end of your next turn deals an extra {@damage 1d12} lightning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: You gain immunity to lightning damage.

The distance you can teleport with this carving increases to 60 feet and the lightning damage increases to {@damage 2d12}. This carving can be used in this way a number of times equal to 2 + your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Additionally, you can use the rampaging electricity that courses through you to cast the {@spell create undead} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you use this carving to cast this spell, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

items: Lightning Scion, Drawn|SGttEH
Lightning Scion, Tattooed|SGttEH
Lightning Scion, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Mephitic Seal
entries: This intricate carving is a rotten word, nauseating to those who hear it and causing plagues upon the world, or so the story goes. A rogue faction of manikins has managed to locate the original carving and have been using it to further their own goals, much to the dismay of beings of flesh—yet such power could so easily be turned against them.

entries.name: Miasma of Death
entries: As an action, you can conjure a toxic miasma in a 15-foot-radius sphere at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. The sphere spreads around corners. The miasma remains there until the end of your next turn. Each creature that is completely within the miasma at the start of its turn must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking a number of {@dice d6|d6s} of poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus and becoming {@condition poisoned} for the duration of the miasma on a failed save. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. You can use this carving twice, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
When you summon the miasma, it gains your choice of 1 property from the following list of options:

items.name: Obfuscation:
entries: The area becomes heavily obscured.

items.name: Immunity:
entries: You are immune to and ignore the effects of the miasma.

items.name: Duration:
entries: The miasma lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. You can move the miasma up to 10 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns. If this carving is scarified, you can move it up to 30 feet instead.

items.name: Radius:
entries: The radius increases to 25 feet.

items.name: Virulent:
entries: The damage dice become {@dice d12|d12s} instead of {@dice d6|d6s}.

items.name: Lingering:
entries: On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: You can use this carving a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
When you summon the miasma, it instead gains your choice of 2 properties. Add the following properties to the list of options:

items.name: Corrosion:
entries: The miasma deals an extra number of {@dice d4|d4s} of acid damage equal to your proficiency bonus on a failed save. Creatures that fail the saving throw by 5 or more are {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Destruction:
entries: You can cause the miasma to exude a corrosive substance that can eat through 1-inch-thick nonmagical wood, metal, or stone each round. If you do so, the miasma ignores resistance and immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition, and constructs have disadvantage on the saving throw.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: When you summon the miasma, it instead gains your choice of 4 properties. Add the following properties to the list of options:

items.name: Protection:
entries: When you summon the miasma, you can choose a number of creatures other than yourself equal to your proficiency bonus; they are immune to the effects of the miasma. You must {@status concentration||concentrate} on this carving as you would {@status concentration||concentrate} on a spell.

items.name: Hallucinatory Toxins:
entries: You turn your miasma into powerful hallucinogens, changing its damage type from poison to psychic. The saving throw becomes an Intelligence saving throw instead. Any other property of the miasma that inflicts poison damage instead inflicts psychic damage. You cannot use the Destruction property alongside this one.

items: Mephitic Seal, Drawn|SGttEH
Mephitic Seal, Tattooed|SGttEH
Mephitic Seal, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Nawre's Blessing
entries: Carmella's Greenhouse was frequently referred to as a morgue because only individuals on the verge of death were accepted in its walls. Through her studies, she discovered that implanting {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH} would artificially prolong her patients' lives, despite the fact that the fungus would consume the host's soul, leaving them an empty husk. It wasn't until she granted her favors to an enigmatic being that she was able to grasp a true solution—something that would bring the dead back to life. Despite their unearthly appearance, they are totally in control of their bodies, or so she claims.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You start grasping the depth of the eldritch truth. If your body is not infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, you gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to any {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Insight}, or {@skill Religion} checks you make.

If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, your symbiotic relationship with the fungus begins. You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: Your mind gazes deep into the revelations of the void. If your body is not infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, you gain a {@dice 1d8} bonus to any Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}), Wisdom ({@skill Insight}), or Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) checks you make. In addition, you gain a {@dice 1d4} bonus to all Wisdom, Intelligence and Charisma saving throws you make. This bonus increases to {@dice 1d8} on saving throws against madness.

If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, your symbiotic relationship with the fungus begins. You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells. In addition, you learn a warlock invocation of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites (you can treat invocations that require a certain warlock level as if they instead require a certain character level). When you gain a level, you can replace this invocation with another that you meet the prerequisites for.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: You become one with the eldritch truth. You die. If your body is infected with the {@item cordyceps sinensis|SGttEH}, it wipes this understanding away from your brain, and if you were not dead for longer than 100 years, you come back to life over the course of an hour. The carving closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all diseases, and lifts any curses that were affecting you when you died. The fungus replaces damaged or missing organs or limbs. The more tissue you were missing, the more fungic your appearance. In addition, you gain the following benefits:

You learn 2 warlock cantrips of your choice, using Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (choose one when you first receive this carving) as your spellcasting ability for these spells. In addition, you learn a warlock invocation of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites (you can treat invocations that require a certain warlock level as if they instead require a certain character level). When you gain a level, you can replace this invocation with another that you meet the prerequisites for.

If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you do not fall {@condition unconscious}. You still make death saving throws and can be stabilized as normal. If you are stable for 1 minute, you regain 1 hit point.

If you die and haven't taken fire or radiant damage within the last minute, you come back to life with 1 hit point after an hour. If you are exposed to fire or radiant damage during that period, you do not resurrect.

items: Nawre's Blessing, Drawn|SGttEH
Nawre's Blessing, Tattooed|SGttEH
Nawre's Blessing, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Roaring Scionic Armament
entries: Roaring scionic weapons are the pinnacle of scionic technology, requiring hefty resources to produce even one of them. They all require attunement. When attuning to such a weapon, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} lightning damage.
items: Roaring Scionic Armament, Melee|SGttEH
Roaring Scionic Armament, Ranged|SGttEH
Roaring Scionic Armament, Spellcasting Focus|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Sacrificial Brand
entries: The carving, notorious among hunters and commonly dubbed the "Brand of Death," is a harbinger of an early demise for those burdened with its curse. Nevertheless, Steinhardt and Martyr Tulio—valiant souls undaunted by fear—etched the eldritch sigil into their own skin willingly. By bearing the ominous symbol, they sought to lure the beasts closer to them during the Hunt, granting their beleaguered brethren moments of respite amidst the chaos.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: During the three days of the Blood Moon, all evil-aligned creatures within Luyarnha gain advantage on {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} checks to locate creatures with this carving.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: During the three days of the Blood Moon, all evil-aligned creatures within Luyarnha gain advantage on {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} checks to locate creatures with this carving. If they are within 120 feet of a creature bearing the carving, they know their exact location and receive a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls against them.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: During the three days of the Blood Moon, all evil-aligned creatures within Luyarnha gain advantage on {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} checks to locate creatures with this carving. If they are within 300 feet of a creature bearing the carving, they know their exact location and receive a {@damage 1d4} bonus to attack and damage rolls against them.

In addition, creatures bearing this carving begin to painfully bleed from it when hostile monsters within 300 feet of them are aware of their position. They cannot be surprised for the duration of the Blood Moon.

Sacrificial Brand, Tattooed|SGttEH
Sacrificial Brand, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Scionic Armament
entries: The Scions' weapons—whether dead or alive—are constructed from the bones of formidable monsters which are then tortured with strong lightning, granting twisted appearance and savage fury to the armament. The weapon's osseous component grants it ancient strength, and the electricity that dances across its body brutalizes all who come in contact with it.
Scionic weapons all require attunement. When attuning to such a weapon, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage.
items: Scionic Armament, Melee|SGttEH
Scionic Armament, Ranged|SGttEH
Scionic Armament, Spellcasting Focus|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Second Carving
entries: The Second Carving—the Voice of Creation, said to originate from the ancient scriptures of a lost civilization—manifests the omnipotence of He who spoke it into being. A power that reflects the terror of what lies beyond, as this single word holds the potential to unravel reality in a myriad of ways.

No mortal should be given this power of creation, their hubris begetting suffering and tyranny. The last possessor of this carving, the Godless King, proclaimed himself divine, turning the world into hell, for it meant that he could rule over its ashes as a god.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: You understand {@language Celestial} and {@language Deep Speech}. Further, you are imbued with righteous power and gain the ability to cast spells. Constitution or Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells, whichever is higher. You can use each of the following decrees once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Each decree only requires the verbal component of the spell.

items.name: Decree of Obedience
entries: You force the heretic to kneel and worship. You can cast the {@spell command} spell, using only the grovel command.

items.name: Decree of Power
entries: You unleash destructive might. You can cast the {@spell bless} spell on willing creatures. When a creature rolls a 1 on the {@dice d4} as part of this spell, it can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1. Creatures under the effect of the spell also take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage (which cannot be reduced) at the start of each of their turns.

items.name: Decree of Blood
entries: You harangue your soldiers to endure. You can cast the {@spell healing word} spell on a willing creature. Until the end of the target's next turn, it gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, but each time it takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the same type.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: You can speak {@language Celestial} and {@language Deep Speech}.

entries.name: Aegis of the Almighty
entries: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Each day at dawn, you can choose one creature that you can see. For the next 24 hours, it has resistance to radiant damage as long as it remains within 10 feet of you and you are conscious.
In addition, you can now use each of your decrees a number of times equal to your Constitution or Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Aegis of the Almighty
entries: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Friendly creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you have resistance to radiant damage while you are conscious.
In addition, you can amplify the effect of your decrees. When you do so, you expend two uses instead of one.

items.name: Improved Decree of Obedience
entries: When you cast {@spell command} with this decree, you can target a number of creatures of your choice you can see within range equal to your Constitution or Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher.

items.name: Improved Decree of Power
entries: When you cast {@spell bless} with this decree, creatures under the effect of the spell gain an additional action on each of their turns. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action. The damage they take at the start of their turn increases to {@damage 2d4}.

items.name: Improved Decree of Blood
entries: When you cast {@spell healing word} with this decree, it is cast at 7th level. Until the end of the target's next turn, it gains a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls, but each time it takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 2d4} damage of the same type.

items: Second Carving, Drawn|SGttEH
Second Carving, Tattooed|SGttEH
Second Carving, Scarified|SGttEH

itemGroup.name: Third Carving
entries: The Third Carving is Mikha'el—The Left Hand of Creation, the herald of punishment.

entries.name: Drawn
entries: When you roll initiative, you can choose to let the carving consume you for 1 minute (no action required). You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Wings of Judgement
entries: Wings sprout on your back, granting you a flying speed of 30 feet. You can only use this speed to move towards a hostile creature that you can see.

items.name: Seraphic Blade
entries: A blade of eldritch—or perhaps divine—energy appears in your hand. This blade is a magic weapon that has the {@itemProperty F||finesse} property and deals {@damage 1d6} fire and {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on a hit.
Once you use this carving, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Tattooed
entries: When you let the carving consume you, you instead gain the following improved benefits for the duration:

items.name: Wings of Judgement
entries: Wings sprout on your back, granting you a flying speed of 60 feet. You can only use this speed to move towards a hostile creature that you can see.

items.name: Righteous Punishment
entries: Creatures that raise their hand against you—a chosen one—must be punished. When you take damage from a creature you can see within 120 feet, you can use your reaction to emit a psychic shockwave in its direction. The attacking creature must make an Intelligence saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, it takes psychic damage equal to your character level. On a success, it takes half as much damage. As part of the same reaction, you can cause a creature that failed its saving throw to be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. Once you {@condition stunned|PHB|stun} a creature in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Seraphic Blade
entries: A blade of eldritch—or perhaps divine—energy appears in your hand. This blade is a magic weapon that has the finesse and thrown (range 60/120) properties, and it deals {@damage 1d8} fire and {@damage 1d8} psychic damage on a hit. Each time you throw the blade, it flies back to your hand after the attack.

Alternatively, you can cause the blade to fuse with a nonmagical weapon you are holding. If you do so, for the duration, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire and {@damage 1d6} psychic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Scarified
entries: The carving imbues you, permanently granting you the benefits of the Tattooed carving. When you use your Righteous Punishment to {@condition stunned|PHB|stun} a creature, you can do so again after 1 minute. Finally, your Seraphic Blade can fuse with a magical weapon that you are holding.

magicvariant.name: Moongold Ammunition
entries: Some monsters that have immunity or resistance to nonmagical or magical weapons are susceptible to moongilded weapons, so cautious adventurers invest extra coin to plate their weapons, magical or not, with moongold.

Moongold gives a {@damage 1d4} bonus to damage rolls against nonhumanoid creatures. Moongold acts as a guiding light in the darkness; creatures holding or wearing moongold have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and madness.

You can moongild a single weapon or ten pieces of ammunition for 1000 gp. This cost represents not only the price of the moongold, but the time and expertise needed to add moongold to the weapon without making it less effective. Moongold loses its effectiveness over time; if a moongilded weapon has not been recoated in moongold after 3 months, the coating falls off, ending its effects. Recoating a weapon before it loses its moongilding costs 500 gp and refreshes the duration of the moongold.
