The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be scorched by them for 1 minute or until a creature takes an action to douse the fire. While scorched in this way, a creature sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius, takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns, can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}, and the custodian can see it through full cover while within 300 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The custodian makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Blue-Flame Burst
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

bonus.name: Blue-Flame Blast {@recharge 3}
entries: The custodian magically releases a blast of flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature within 5 feet of the custodian can use its reaction to attempt to redirect the flames before creatures make their saving throws. It must make a contested {@skill Athletics} check. On a success, it can choose in which direction the custodian releases the burst of flames.

reaction.name: Blinding Nova
entries: When the custodian is attacked by a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see, the custodian can impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing a burst of blinding flames to erupt from itself. An attacker that can't be {@condition blinded} is immune to this effect.

items.name: Special Equipment
entries: Borast wields an {@item electric sawblade|SGttEH}, which he presents to the party as they leave. (See page 420)

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Dispelling Gaze
headerEntries: The butcher opens the eye on its chest to cast {@spell dispel magic}. The butcher's spellcasting ability for this spell is Charisma.

trait.name: Aberrant Eye
entries: The butcher has an eye in the middle of its torso that it uses to {@spell dispel magic}. The eye is closed unless the butcher uses its bonus action to open it, or uses its Dispelling Gaze. At the start of its next turn, it can choose to close the eye (no action required). While closed, the eye is considered behind total cover and is immune to all damage. While opened, the eye has AC 18, 15 HP, and no resistances or immunities, and the butcher has {@sense truesight} to a range of 60 feet. Any damage dealt to the eye is also dealt to the butcher. If the eye is destroyed, the butcher is {@condition blinded} and can't use its Dispelling Gaze.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The butcher makes two cleaver attacks.

action.name: Cleaver
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage or 18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hand. It can only change its grip at the start of each of its turns.

bonus.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage and the butcher can choose to push the target back up to 10 feet in a straight line if the target is Large or smaller. The butcher can only make this attack if it has a free hand.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The butcher adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the butcher must see the attacker, and be wielding a melee weapon.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't moongilded

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The tenebris can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Intangible Body
entries: The tenebris's body is made of moving shadows; ranged weapon attacks against it are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the tenebris has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Vile Aura
entries: Beasts refuse to approach closer than 30 feet of the tenebris. If a beast ends its turn in that area, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tenebris makes two attacks.

action.name: Cannibalize
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken and the tenebris regains half as many hit points and one use of its Shadow Jump. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

bonus.name: Shadow Jump (2/Day)
entries: The tenebris teleports to a space in darkness that it can see within 60 feet of it. Alternatively, it teleports inside of the space of a Medium or larger creature within 60 feet of it, emerging from the creature's entrails.

bonus.name: Create Shadows
entries: The tenebris targets the corpse of a humanoid within 10 feet of it that died violently in the last hour. The target's spirit rises as a {@creature shadow} in its space and the corpse can't be targeted in this way again. This {@creature shadow} is under the tenebris's control. The tenebris can have no more than two {@creature shadow|MM|shadows} under its control at a time.

reaction.name: Feast on Darkness
entries: When the tenebris reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it devours the creature's shadow. The tenebris's wings grow longer, its flying speed increases by 20 feet, and it gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 minute or until it falls {@condition unconscious}. It can gain this bonus multiple times, each time it devours a creature's shadow. A creature whose shadow has been devoured can't be targeted by this reaction again. A {@spell remove curse} spell cast on a creature that lost its shadow allows it to regrow it.

trait.name: Accursed Blood
entries: At the end of the giant's turns, if it has fewer than half its hit point maximum, each creature within 10 feet of it takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage, unless the giant has taken radiant damage since the end of its last turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant uses its Sweep Chains and then makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sweep Chains
entries: The giant swings its chains, forcing each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure the target is staggered for 1 minute. A staggered creature suffers a {@dice 1d8} penalty on attack rolls, ability checks, and Strength and Dexterity saving throws. The staggered target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Lead Catching
entries: If a rock, cannonball, or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, catching the missile and taking no damage from it on a success.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The maiden's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Sharp Fangs
entries: The maiden has advantage on attack rolls against creatures it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling}.

trait.name: Bone Regeneration
entries: The maiden regains 10 hit points and reforms any of its broken bones at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Magic Strikes
entries: The maiden's attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maiden makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw. It can use Feast instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the maiden can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Feast
entries: The maiden makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is devoured, and the {@action grapple} ends. While devoured, the creature is {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the maiden, and it takes 20 ({@damage 8d4}) piercing damage at the start of each of the maiden's turns. The maiden can only have one creature devoured at a time.

If the maiden takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, its teeth break and the creature inside of it falls {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the maiden. If the maiden dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Spinal Explosion (1/Day)
entries: The maiden releases all the bony protrusions on its spine. Each creature within 30 feet of the maiden must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Each creature that fails the saving throw is also embedded with bony spikes. At the start of the creature's next turn, it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it becomes {@condition restrained}, as its body begins to harden. On a successful save, its body ejects the spikes and it isn't otherwise affected.

A {@condition restrained} creature must make another {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the start of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the creature. On a failure, its skin hardens into bone and it becomes {@condition petrified} until the maiden dies, or until it is released by a {@spell greater restoration} spell.

items.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit ({@hit 6} to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage with shillelagh.

monster.name: Corrupted Treant

items: necrotic
poison
poisoned

items.name: Corpse Bombardment
entries: As an action, a corrupted treant can pull a corpse from its branches and hurl it at a target within 60 feet. The target must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Each creature within 10 feet of the target must also make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

languages: understand Common, Elvish, and Sylvan, but cannot speak

trait.name: Broken Wings
entries: The corvian dweller falls if it ends its turn in the air and nothing else is holding it aloft.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The corvian dweller can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 11} {@skill Insight} check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corvian dweller makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Wing Flutter
entries: If the corvian dweller's speed isn't 0, and it is targeted by a melee attack, it flaps its wings in defense. It moves 5 feet, and makes a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to the attacker's attack roll's total. On a success, it evades completely and the attack misses. On a failure, it halves the attack's damage against itself if the attack hits. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

items.name: Split
entries: When an ooze that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning, slashing, poison, or necrotic damage, it splits into two new oozes if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new ooze has hit points equal to half the original ooze's, rounded down. New oozes are one size smaller than the original ooze.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered or moongilded

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: Death has advantage on melee attack rolls made against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Death's Embrace
entries: A creature killed by Death can be restored to life only by a {@spell wish} spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Death has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Death's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Death is immune to features that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Death uses its Whistle of Death and makes four claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) slashing damage, and the target gains one bleeding die if it's a creature.

A creature can have up to ten bleeding dice, which are {@dice d4|d4s}. A creature rolls its bleeding dice at the start of each of its turns, taking slashing damage equal to the total rolled. This damage can't be reduced in any way. Each time the creature regains hit points, the number of hit points it regains is halved and it loses one bleeding die.

A creature within 5 feet of a creature with one or more bleeding dice can use its action to make a {@skill Medicine} check ({@dc 10} + the number of bleeding dice), removing all bleeding dice on a success. If the creature has a {@item healer's kit|PHB}, it can expend two uses of the kit to automatically succeed on the check.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Death magically polymorphs into {@filter a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own|bestiary|source=|Challenge Rating=[&0;&12]|type=beast;humanoid|miscellaneous=!adventure npc}, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Death's choice).

In a new form, Death retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

action.name: Whistle of Death
entries: One creature of Death's choice within 120 feet of Death and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature that has ever died automatically fails this saving throw. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Death's Whistle of Death for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Final Minute (1/Day)
entries: Death briefly stops the flow of time for all creatures except itself and one creature that it can see. No time passes for other creatures, while Death and the target take 1 minute, during which they can use actions and move as normal.

This effect ends if one of the actions Death uses or effects it creates during this period affects a creature other than it and its target or an object being worn or carried by a creature other than Death and its target. Death must concentrate on this ability (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell).

bonus.name: Scraping Charge
entries: Death moves up to its speed in a straight line toward a target. If Death then hits it with its next claw attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Deflect
entries: Death adds 4 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so Death must see the attacker.

reaction.name: Close the Gap
entries: When Death is targeted by a ranged weapon attack, it can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the attacker. To do so, Death must see the attacker.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The belua has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Crippling Strikes
entries: Creatures provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} from the belua even if they take the {@action Disengage} action before leaving its reach. When the belua hits a creature with an {@action opportunity attack}, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The belua has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Never-Ending Fury
entries: The belua has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws and a +3 bonus to its damage for melee weapon attacks (included in the attacks).

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The belua regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the belua takes damage from a moongilded weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the belua's next turn. The Belua dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The belua makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage. This attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. On a critical hit, the belua's monstrous jaws rip off one of the target's appendages. Roll a {@dice d12} on the following table for the result:

A creature that has an appendage ripped off takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns as it bleeds out, until it receives magical healing. If its gut is ripped off, it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage instead. A creature that loses its head dies if it can't live without it.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d4 + 8}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Bestial Rage (3/Day)
entries: The belua enters a feral rage fuelled by its ravenous hunger. It becomes Huge, it gains 20 temporary hit points, and the number of damage dice of its natural weapon attacks increase by one ({@dice 3d8} for the bite and {@dice 3d4} for the claw). This transformation lasts for 1 minute, or until the belua takes more than 15 damage from a moongilded weapon in a single turn, or until the belua dies.

bonus.name: Leap
entries: The belua jumps up to 50 feet horizontally or vertically.

variant.name: Revelations
entries: Some unfortunate beluas cross path with accursed weapons that robs them of their sight, hastening the scourgeborne's descent into their fully transformed, Devouring kin. Such a belua has a CR of 11, and gains the following trait:

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries: The Devouring Belua has a {@item Revelations|SGttEH} {@homebrew |(SGttEH page 248)}. It can replace its claw attacks with attacks with the weapon.

items.name: Special Equipment
entries: The Devouring Belua has a {@item Revelations|SGttEH} {@homebrew |(SGttEH page 248)}. It can replace its claw attacks with attacks with the weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dreadcrow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

trait.name: Fear Smith
entries: Creatures can't have advantage on saving throws against the dreadcrow's effects that cause the {@condition frightened} condition. While a creature is {@condition frightened} of the dreadcrow, the creature has disadvantage on Intelligence and Wisdom checks, as the creature's reality crumbles.

trait.name: Illusory Horror
entries: The dreadcrow's appearance is an illusion, reflecting the worst fear of the observer. It gains a bonus to its AC equal to its Charisma modifier while it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

In addition, when a creature that can see the dreadcrow starts its turn within 30 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened}. A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the dreadcrow until the start of the creature's next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the dreadcrow in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw. Creatures within 5 feet of the dreadcrow have advantage on this saving throw, as they partially see its true form.
Creatures seeing the dreadcrow with {@sense truesight} ignore this trait's effects.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Dreadcrow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dreadcrow makes two attacks with its claws or Devour Fear. It can use Living Nightmare in place of one attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) slashing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Devour Fear
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) psychic damage. If the target is {@condition frightened}, the dreadcrow has advantage on the attack roll and regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Flay Sanity {@recharge 5}
entries: The dreadcrow creates atrocious illusions that rend sanity. Each creature within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH} and become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. {@condition Frightened} creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This action doesn't reveal the dreadcrow if it's hidden.

action.name: Living Nightmare (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The dreadcrow becomes the embodiment of terror for a creature that is {@condition frightened} of it within 60 feet of it. This unleashes a primal fear within the target, causing the target to go insane. It must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target bellows a scream so powerful that it rips its own vocal cords and it loses the ability to speak. If the target is still {@condition frightened} of the dreadcrow at the start of the dreadcrow's next turn and the target can see the dreadcrow, the terror becomes so untenable that it rips out its own eyes, becoming {@condition blinded}.

bonus.name: Gaze Upon Me
entries: The dreadcrow forces a creature that it can see within 30 feet to look at it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom check or look directly at the Dreadcrow.

reaction.name: Skittering Walk
entries: When a creature moves within 5 feet of the Dreadcrow, the Dreadcrow can move up to 20 feet. Its AC increases by 3 during this movement.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The avatar's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The avatar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aberrant Mind
entries: The avatar can maintain {@status concentration} on two spells at the same time. If it loses {@status concentration}, it loses both spells.

trait.name: Aberrant Magic
entries: Each time a creature fails a saving throw against a spell cast by the avatar, the creature also gains a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}.

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the avatar that starts its turn within 30 feet of the avatar must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, unless the avatar is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the avatar's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Gift of Guilt
entries: Whenever a creature damages the avatar, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be wracked with remorse for its actions and take psychic damage equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The avatar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sanctified Being
entries: The avatar is permanently under the effect of the {@spell sanctuary} spell, and attacking, casting spells, and dealing damage doesn't end the spell.

action.name: Mind Break
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150 ft., one creature. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) psychic damage and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Time Loop
entries: The avatar chooses a creature it can see within 150 feet of it, attempting to force the creature to repeat itself. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or, on its next turn, it is forced to use the same action and bonus action it performed on its previous turn. If the target can't perform the same action or bonus action (for example casting a spell because it is out of spell slots) it wastes the action and bonus action instead.

bonus.name: Gift of Power
entries: The avatar utters a word of power. Allied creatures within 60 feet of the avatar that can hear it gain a power die that can be added to any die roll once before it's expended. The die begins as a {@dice d4}, but increase to a {@dice d8}, {@dice d10}, and finally a {@dice d12} each time Gift of Power is used on the creature prior to it expending the die.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't moongilded

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dullahan's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The dullahan can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

2e: {@spell hex} (5th level, damage can't break the dullahan's concentration)

trait.name: Accursed Beacon
entries: The dullahan knows the exact location of creatures that are under the effect of its spells as long as they are on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Relentless Advance
entries: The dullahan is unaffected by {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and can move over water and other liquids. It can't willingly enter consecrated areas such as churches; it takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage at the start of each of its turns while within such an area.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dullahan makes two attacks with its spine whip.

action.name: Spine Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The dullahan takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

reaction.name: Maddening Sight
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the dullahan targets it with an attack or spell, the dullahan can force the creature to gaze into its severed head. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute and gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition blinded} condition on a success.

variant.name: Tree Stride Amulet
entries: To enter in and out of fortified walls, many dullahans are bestowed a {@item tree stride amulet|SGttEH}.

monster.name: Enhanced Patient
languages: understands Common but can only speak in short incoherent sentences

trait.name: Ocular Apparatus
entries: The device grafted onto the patient's head opens its mind to the beyond. It is {@condition blinded|PHB|blind}.

trait.name: Mad Strength
entries: The patient deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage when it hits with any melee attack. (included in the statblock.)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The patient makes one attack with its metal limb. On a hit, the patient can make one bite attack against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage, and the patient regains hit points equal to the piercing damage dealt.

action.name: Metal Limb
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning or slashing damage (patient's choice) and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

bonus.name: Wail of Insanity {@recharge}
entries: The patient unleashes the chaos within itself. A creature of the patient's choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The fallen has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The fallen has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the fallen's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Visceral Strike
entries: The fallen deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage when determining the extra damage for a critical hit it scores against a creature with a melee attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Bloated Nightmare
entries: Some fallen are bloated with bestial energy from their over-exposure to the Scourge. These fallen are distinguishable from others of their kind by their distended and swollen abdomen. They gain the following trait.

entries.name: Fallen Echoes
entries: If the fallen is killed by a hostile creature, it explodes in a crimson mist. All creatures that are allied to it within 30 feet of it become enhanced for 2 rounds (on this initiative count, losing initiative ties). Whenever an enhanced creature makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, the target can roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to the result.

spellcasting.name: Call of the Storm (1/Day)
headerEntries: The prowler howls as a bonus action, summoning a storm cloud above itself that it can direct, as per the {@spell call lightning} spell ({@dc 16}). In addition, it can use a bonus action on each of its turns while {@status concentration||concentrating} on the spell to target itself with a bolt of lightning.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The prowler's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the prowler is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage. Instead, it regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt and can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see and make one claw attack.

trait.name: Lightning Reflexes
entries: The prowler always takes its turn first in initiative order.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prowler makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Nova {@recharge 5}
entries: The prowler unleashes electricity with an explosive scream. Each creature within 20 feet of the prowler must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage and can't use reactions or bonus actions until the end of the prowler's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is also {@condition stunned} until the end of the prowler's next turn.

bonus.name: Rampage
entries: If the prowler reduced a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack this turn, it moves up to half its speed and make a claw attack.

reaction.name: Thunderous Revival (1/Day)
entries: When the prowler is reduced to 0 hit points, it emits a thunderous howl, instantly regaining 33 ({@dice 6d10}) hit points. Each creature within 10 feet of the prowler must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage and being knock {@condition prone} on a failed saving throw, or taking half as much damage and not being knock {@condition prone} on a successful one. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is also {@condition stunned} until the end of the prowler's next turn.

legendary.name: Leap
entries: The prowler jumps a number of feet up to its speed and lands on its feet in a space that can contain one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creatures takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} . On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the prowler's space.

monster.name: Geist
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Abhorrent Body
entries: The geist can assume either an ethereal or material form. In its ethereal form, it has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks that aren't moongilded or silvered. In its material form, it has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from magical attacks that aren't moongilded or silvered. The geist can change form as a bonus action. The geist's other traits and actions are determined by its form.

trait.name: Death Burst (Material Form)
entries: When the geist dies, it explodes in a burst of poison. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement (Ethereal Form)
entries: The geist can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. If it changes to its material form while inside an object, it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage and is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity (Ethereal Form)
entries: While in sunlight, the geist has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Glacial Touch (Ethereal Form)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Rotten Touch (Material Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Cleave (Hunter)
entries: When Gerhard makes a melee weapon attack, it can choose to make another attack with the same weapon against one other creature within 5 feet of the original target and within reach as part of the same attack.

trait.name: Herald of Ruin
entries: when Gerhard hits a physical barrier created by a spell, such as the effect of a {@spell wall of force} or {@spell forcecage} spell, or any other wall spell (such as {@spell wall of fire} or {@spell prismatic wall}), it can make a Strength check (DC equals 10 + the spell's level), rupturing the arcane and dispelling the spell on a success.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Gerhard has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Smash (Hunter)
entries: Once per turn, when Gerhard hits a {@condition prone} creature with a maul attack, the hit becomes a critical hit.

trait.name: Trample (Beast)
entries: If Gerhard hits a creature with a hooves attack, the target takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Unbreaking Hide
entries: While Gerhard has fewer than 166, 116, or 66 hit points, it gains a +2, +4, or +6 bonus to its AC, respectively.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Gerhard fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack (Beast)
entries: Gerhard uses its Charge and makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its hooves. It can replace a hooves attack with a maul attack.

action.name: Multiattack (Hunter)
entries: Gerhard makes three attacks: one with its hooves and two with its maul. It can replace a maul attack with a hooves attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charge (Beast)
entries: Gerhard moves up to 20 feet in a straight line without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}, and can pass through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures. If it moves through a creature's space during that movement, the target must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. If Gerhard ends this movement in a creature's space, the creature is pushed out to the nearest unoccupied space.

action.name: Spectral Slaughter (Hunter; Recharge 5-6)
entries: Gerhard sends forth up to six spectral duplicates of itself to strike down enemies within 120 feet of itself. Each enemy can be targeted by no more than two duplicates. Each duplicate makes a maul attack against a target that deals 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage on a hit.
Gerhard can then use a bonus action to move up to 120 feet in a straight line towards one of the targets without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} and make a maul attack.

bonus.name: Stance
entries: Gerhard changes between stances, either standing on all fours (beast) or standing on its hind legs (hunter), granting it certain features noted by that stance name.

bonus.name: Dash (Beast)
entries: Gerhard moves up to 40 feet.

reaction.name: Dodge (Beast)
entries: If Gerhard's speed isn't 0, and it is targeted by a melee attack, it moves back 10 feet without triggering {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. If this causes Gerhard to leave the attack's reach, it evades the attack completely, causing it to miss.

reaction.name: Retributive Strike (Hunter)
entries: After taking damage, Gerhard makes one maul or hooves attack.

legendary.name: Focus (Hunter; 1/Day)
entries: Gerhard regains 21 ({@dice 6d6}) hit points and recharges its Spectral Slaughter.

legendary.name: Maul
entries: Gerhard makes one maul attack.

legendary.name: Regenerate
entries: Gerhard regains 21 ({@dice 6d6}) hit points.

legendary.name: Howl (Beast)
entries: Gerhard releases a monstrous howl. Each creature of Gerhard's choice within 60 feet of it that can hear it gains 14 ({@dice 4d6}) temporary hit points.

monster.name: Goat Mother's Avatar
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The avatar's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components::

trait.name: Curse Weaver
entries: The avatar's curses last for 1 minute. A cursed creature can make a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the oldest of these curses on itself on a success. If a creature drinks a {@item Holy Water (flask)|PHB|vial of holy water}, the DC of its next such saving throw is reduced by 5. A {@spell remove curse} spell removes only one curse of the caster's choosing (or one at random). A {@spell greater restoration} spell ends all curses on the target.

trait.name: Cycle of Rebirth
entries: If the avatar is reduced to 0 hit points, she teleports to the center of her nearest Circle of Rebirth, regains 50 hit points, and all her curses end. Until the end of her next turn, she can't be reduced below 1 hit point.

trait.name: Goat Leap
entries: The avatar's long jump is up to 120 feet and her high jump is up to 60 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the avatar fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mother Tongue
entries: The avatar can communicate with creatures she has summoned as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Nurturing Essence
entries: Whenever a creature summoned by the avatar ends its turn within 10 feet of her, it regains 16 ({@dice 3d10}) hit points.

trait.name: Progenitor's Tears
entries: Whenever a creature that was summoned by the avatar dies, the avatar mourns its death, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and becoming enraged, granting her advantage on attack rolls until the end of her next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The avatar uses her Maddening Presence, then makes three attacks. She can use Circle of Rebirth in place of one of her attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) slashing damage and 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Charisma saving throw or fall under the Curse of Goat's Blood. While cursed in this way, a creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls it makes while within the avatar's Circles of Rebirth.

action.name: Curse
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 17} to hit, range 300 ft., one creature. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) poison damage and the target suffers one of the following curses (avatar's choice):

items.name: Curse of Acquired Scent
entries: Creatures summoned by the avatar have advantage on attack rolls against this creature.

items.name: Curse of Draining Life
entries: Whenever the creature would regain hit points, the avatar regains those hit points instead.

items.name: Curse of the Red Moon
entries: The creature can't cast spells of 5th level or higher.

action.name: Maddening Presence
entries: The avatar expunges doom from her many faces. Each creature of the avatar's choice within 120 feet of the avatar and aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. A creature {@condition paralyzed} in this way isn't {@condition incapacitated}, though it still can't move or speak. If a creature has failed this saving throw three times, it also gains an {@table indefinite madness|SGttEH}. If a creature's saving throw is successful or it has already gained an {@table indefinite madness|SGttEH} from this action, the creature is otherwise immune to the avatar's Maddening Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Circle of Rebirth {@recharge 4}
entries: Using her birthing powers, the avatar creates a 15-foot-radius circle centered on a point within 120 feet of her. When the circle appears and at the start of each of the avatar's turns, she can summon {@filter any aberration, beast, humanoid, or monstrosity of CR 5 lower|bestiary|source=|Challenge Rating=[&0;&5]|type=aberration;beast;humanoid;monstrosity|miscellaneous=!adventure npc}, which emerges under her control from an unoccupied space in the circle. The creature shares her initiative count, but takes its turn immediately after her, following the avatar's telepathic commands (no action required by her).

The circle has 50 hit points and AC 21. It has resistance to cold, fire, and necrotic damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. If the avatar summons three monsters from it or the circle is reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

reaction.name: Maternal Instincts
entries: When a creature summoned by the avatar within 30 feet of her is targeted by an attack roll, she can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The avatar makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The avatar makes a {@skill Perception} check.

legendary.name: Dark Voyage (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The avatar teleports to an unoccupied space within one of her Circles of Rebirth.

legendary.name: Goat Mother's Will (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The avatar amplifies all curses she currently has active, weakening her foes. Each creature currently under the effect of a curse must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw or suffer an additional effect based on the curse affecting it, which lasts until the curse is removed:

items.name: Curse of Goat's Blood
items.entry: At the start of each of its turns, the creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

items.name: Curse of Acquired Scent
items.entry: Whenever the creature takes damage from a creature summoned by the avatar, it takes an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage.

items.name: Curse of Draining Life
items.entry: The creature has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws and checks.

items.name: Curse of the Red Moon
items.entry: At the start of each of its turns, the creature loses its highest level spell slot.

hp.special: 5 + 5 times your cleric level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your cleric level)

trait.name: Incorporeal Being
entries: The angel can move through other creatures as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

action.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} radiant or necrotic damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

bonus.name: Reality Warp
entries: The angel teleports to an empty space adjacent to an allied creature within 60 feet of it.

reaction.name: Self Sacrifice
entries: When a creature other than the angel is hit by an attack while within 30 feet of the angel, the angel can teleport into the creature's space, taking the damage instead of the creature. To do so, the angel must be able to see both the creature and the attacker.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB + 2d8} necrotic damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} necrotic damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} necrotic damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB + 1d8} necrotic damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB + 2d8} radiant damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} radiant damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} radiant damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

items.name: Divine Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 10 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB + 1d8} radiant damage and the angel regains half as many hit points.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't moongilded or silvered

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

trait.name: Warding Strikes
entries: When the gargoyle hits a creature with an attack, it can mark the creature until the end of the gargoyle's next turn or until the creature is marked by another gargoyle. While it is within 30 feet of the gargoyle, the marked creature has disadvantage on attack rolls that don't target the gargoyle.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gargoyle makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Boulder
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Stone Defense
entries: When another creature within 5 feet of the gargoyle takes damage, the gargoyle can partially turn it to stone, giving the target resistance to the triggering damage type(s) until the start of the target's next turn.

monster.name: Hollow Sentinel
languages: understands Deep Speech but doesn't speak it

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Sentinel's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Iron Will
entries: The Sentinel has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and magic can't put the Sentinel to sleep.

trait.name: Mithral Bones
entries: The Sentinel doesn't have bones.

trait.name: Silvered Weapons
entries: The Sentinel's weapon attacks are silvered.

trait.name: Mage Breaker
entries: When the Sentinel damages a creature that is {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, the DC for the saving throw the target makes to maintain its {@status concentration} is increased by 7 (minimum 17). In addition, the Sentinel has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Sentinel is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sentinel makes four blade attacks.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Mithral Wind Strike (1/Day)
entries: The Sentinel chooses up to three creatures it can see within 30 feet of it and makes a melee spell attack ({@hit 6} to hit) against each target. On a hit, a target takes 19 ({@damage 3d12}) slashing damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage. It can then teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of one of the targets. The Sentinel regains the use of this action if a creature within 30 feet of it loses {@status concentration} on a spell.

bonus.name: Breaking Palm
entries: The Sentinel touches a creature within 5 feet of it, removing any temporary hit points the target has.

bonus.name: Dash
entries: The Sentinel takes the {@action Dash} action.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Sentinel adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Sentinel must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Anti-Magic Strike
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Sentinel casts a spell, the Sentinel can make a melee weapon attack against it.

trait.name: Flexible Combatant
entries: When the hunter draws or stows a weapon, it can draw or stow another weapon with the other hand. It can reload weapons with the loading, reload, or barrel properties without a free hand.

Additionally, if the hunter is carrying a one-handed melee weapon in one hand, and a one-handed ranged weapon in the other hand, it doesn't have disadvantage on attack rolls with ranged weapons from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hunter makes two longsword attacks. If it has a firearm drawn, it can also make a firearm attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Firearm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Dodge Step (3/Short Rest)
entries: If the hunter's speed isn't 0, and it is targeted by an attack, it dodges in defense. It moves 5 feet, and makes a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to the attacker's attack roll's total. On a success, it evades completely and the attack misses. On a failure, it halves the attack's damage against itself if the attack hits. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

items.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

items.name: Firearm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Encircling Strikes
entries: Once per turn, when the jaeger attacks from the opposite side of a creature from where it started its turn, or attacks while on the opposite side of a creature from an ally, it deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage on a hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the jaeger is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the jaeger instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Flexible Combatant
entries: When the jaeger draws or stows a weapon, it can draw or stow another weapon with the other hand. It can reload weapons with the loading, reload, or barrel properties without a free hand.

Additionally, if the jaeger is carrying a one-handed melee weapon in one hand, and a one-handed ranged weapon in the other hand, it doesn't have disadvantage on attack rolls with ranged weapons from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

trait.name: Hemorrhaging Wound {@recharge 5}
entries: The jaeger can't use this trait on the first round of combat. When the jaeger hits a creature with a blade attack, it rends a vicious wound. At the end of each of the target's turns, it loses 17 ({@dice 5d6}) hit points. Each time the target takes damage from this effect, the number of dice of damage it takes at the end of its next turn is reduced by one, and the bleeding stops when the number of dice is reduced to 0. A bleeding creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, after taking the damage, ending the effect on a success. The DC equals 15 + half the number of dice of damage remaining (rounded down).
If the jaeger hits a bleeding target with a blade attack, the target doesn't gain a new wound, but its wound's damage resets to {@dice 5d6}.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The jaeger's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Piercing Gaze (1/Day)
entries: The jaeger gains {@sense darkvision} out to 120 feet and the effect of {@spell see invisibility} for 1 hour (no action required).

trait.name: Sharp Senses
entries: Whenever the jaeger uses its Dodge Step, Weapon Parry, or Chasing Finisher, it gains advantage on its next attack roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The jaeger wields a {@item dream executioner|SGttEH}. Alternatively it can be wielding an {@item orphan's cradle|SGttEH}, a {@item serpent bladewhip|SGttEH}, or a {@item meat hookshot|SGttEH}. Its blade attack and references to it are replaced with an attack made with the respective weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jaeger makes three blade attacks. If it is wielding a firearm, it can also make one firearm attack.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Firearm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Chasing Finisher {@recharge 5}
entries: The jaeger moves 40 feet and makes a blade attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Dodge Step (3/Short Rest)
entries: When a creature the jaeger can see attacks it, if its speed isn't 0, it moves up to 10 feet without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} and makes a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to the attack roll's result. On a success, it evades completely and the attack misses. On a failure, it takes only half damage if the attack hits.

reaction.name: Weapon Parry (3/Short Rest)
entries: The jaeger fires off a bullet to deflect an attack that it can see within 60 feet of it. To do so, the jaeger must be wielding a firearm. It reduces the attack's damage by 13 ({@dice 1d10 + 8}). If this reduces the damage to 0, the attacker is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn, as the bullet hits a nervous junction.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The living artillery ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The living artillery has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Self-Destruct
entries: When the living artillery is reduced to 0 hit points, its unstable body detonates. Each creature within 20 feet of the living artillery must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living artillery makes four attacks: three with its tentacles and one with its cannon.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 3d4 + 2}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the living artillery can {@action grapple} the target if it's a creature (escape {@dc 16}). The living artillery can have up to three creatures {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d12 + 2}) piercing damage and the living artillery rolls a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 3 or higher, the ammunition detonates and each creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. Flammable objects in the area take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

bonus.name: Engage
entries: If the living artillery has all its hit points, it moves up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

variant.name: Gatling Gun
entries: The living artillery can have a gatling gun grafted to its arm instead of a cannon.

entries.name: Gatling Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120/360 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. Until the start of its next turn, at the start of each creature's turn, the living artillery can make this attack again. Each time it makes this attack, it rolls a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1, the gun stops early and can't fire again until it uses this action again.

items.name: Gatling Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120/360 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. Until the start of its next turn, at the start of each creature's turn, the living artillery can make this attack again. Each time it makes this attack, it rolls a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1, the gun stops early and can't fire again until it uses this action again.

items.name: Multiattack
entries: The living artillery makes four attacks: three with its tentacles and one with its gatling gun.

trait.name: Eldritch Resilience
entries: The swarm has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Litany's Influence
entries: At the start of each of the swarm's turns, each character within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the character takes psychic damage equal to the swarm's hit points divided by 20, rounded down, (e.g., 50 psychic damage at 1000 hit points) and cannot take reactions until the start of their next turn. On a success, they take half as much damage and are unaffected by the reaction restriction.

trait.name: Swarm Movement
entries: The swarm moves as a single entity, occupying a 25-foot by 25-foot space. For every 200 hit points the horde loses, each side of its area shrinks by 5 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes four Melee attacks.

action.name: Melee
entries: Use a single attack roll with an attack bonus equal to the swarm's hit points divided by 70, rounded down (e.g., {@hit 14} at 1000 hit points), range: 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d6}) bludgeoning damage. This damage is reduced by {@dice 1d6} for each 100 hit points the swarm has lost.

action.name: Overwhelm
entries: If the swarm has more than half of its hit points remaining, it can use its action to attempt to overwhelm a character. The target must make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the swarm's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, with a bonus equal to the swarm's hit points divided by 50, rounded down (e.g., {@skillCheck athletics 20} at 1000 hit points). On a failure, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}).

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the revenant must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the revenant's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours. If a creature cannot see the revenant, it automatically fails the saving throw.

trait.name: Lunar Invisibility
entries: While not in moonlight, the revenant is {@condition invisible} and {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The revenant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The revenant's attacks are magical.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The revenant can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes three attacks: two slams and one with its greatsword.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The revenant magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is illuminated by moonlight.

action.name: Maddening Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The revenant howls an inaudible sound that shatters the mind. Each creature within 60 feet of the revenant must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage and gaining one {@table short-term madness|SGttEH} on a failure.

ac.condition: while he has 81 or fewer hit points

walk.condition: while he has 81 or fewer hit points

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Malach's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). Malach can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Angel of Flesh
entries: Malach's form changes according to his hit points, losing his mantle of flesh when reduced below half his hit point maximum: While he has more than 81 hit points, Malach is draped in the flesh of the foes he fell. He has the following benefits:

items: A flying speed of 120 feet, using his wings of flesh.
Advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight.
He can cast {@spell alter self} at will, requiring no components, disguising himself with flesh.

entries: While he has 81 hit points or fewer, Malach reveals the perfected golden machine beneath, and has the following benefits:

items: Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws against effects he can see.
He can make two additional censer attacks as part of his Multiattack
A +2 bonus to AC
His speed is increased by 20 feet.

trait.name: Champion of Constructs
entries: Malach can telepathically communicate to and understand constructs within 500 feet of him.

trait.name: Consuming Hatred
entries: If Malach starts his turn within 5 feet of an enemy humanoid, he must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become consumed by wrath and spend his action attacking the creature with his censer.

trait.name: Deadly Miasma
entries: Malach's censer emits a 10-foot-radius sphere of poisonous fog centered on itself. The fog spreads around corners and lightly obscures the area. When a non-construct creature enters the fog's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Malach fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Malach's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Malach makes two censer attacks.

action.name: Censer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@dice 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Create Miasma
entries: Malach creates a 15-foot-radius sphere of poisonous fog centered on a point within 60 feet of him. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts until the end of Malach's next turn. Its area is heavily obscured for creatures other than Malach. The fog otherwise functions like that of his Deadly Miasma trait.

action.name: Bane of Flesh {@recharge}
entries: Malach chooses a non-construct creature he can see within 15 feet of him and attempts to rip out its flesh with vile magic. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage and 27 ({@damage 6d8}) lightning damage. Creatures within Malach's Deadly Miasma have disadvantage on this saving throw and the weakening miasma causes the damage to ignore damage resistance.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Malach makes one censer attack.

legendary.name: Zealous Path
entries: Malach moves up to his speed. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Miasma (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Malach uses his Create Miasma.

legendary.name: Higher Purpose (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Malach reaches for a higher purpose. This effect changes based on his Angel of Flesh trait.

If above 81 hit points, Malach releases an all-powerful miasma with a 20-foot radius centered on a point 120 feet of him. Each non-construct creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of Malach's next turn. While {@condition paralyzed} in this way, a creature automatically fails its saving throws against Malach's Deadly Miasma.

If at or below 81 hit points, Malach uses his golden form to release a glimmer of sickening light. Each non-construct creature within 120 feet of Malach must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. This ignores immunity to the {@condition poisoned} condition. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Nightgaunt
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Blank Face
entries: When a creature that can see the nightgaunt start its turn within 5 feet of the nightgaunt or enter that area for the first time on a turn, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the nightgaunt for 1 minute and gain a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the {@condition frightened} condition ends for it, the creature is immune to the nightgaunt's Blank Face for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The nightgaunt doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nightgaunt has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Silent Tormenter
entries: The nightgaunt makes no sound, ever. It has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks and is automatically hidden from creatures that can't see it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nightgaunt makes two claw attacks and uses its Tail.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). The nightgaunt has two claws, each of which can {@action grapple} only one target. Until this {@action grapple} ends, the nightgaunt can't use that claw to attack any other creature.

action.name: Tail
entries: The nightgaunt uses its tail in one of the following ways.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: The nightgaunt flails its tail towards a creature that it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be overwhelmed by the pain and be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of the nightgaunt's next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead {@condition stunned} until the start of the nightgaunt's next turn, as it loses control of its body. Creatures that have a speed of 0 have disadvantage on this saving throw.

bonus.name: Night Rush
entries: The nightgaunt moves up to half its flying speed.

reaction.name: Feed on Emotions
entries: When a creature within 10 feet of the nightgaunt fails a saving throw against its Blank Face or Prehensile Tail, the nightgaunt can feed on the creature's emotions—fear, anger, surprise—and regains 8 ({@dice 1d10 + 3}) hit points. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, the nightgaunt regains 14 ({@dice 2d10 + 3}) hit points instead.

trait.name: Abhorrent Presence
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the centipede, the creature must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. If the creature has never encountered a centipede before, it gains a {@table long-term madness|SGttEH} on a failure, or a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH} on a success. A creature that has encountered a centipede before gains a {@table short-term madness|SGttEH} on a failure, and no madness on a success.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: Nightmare centipedes share a bond with other members of their hive that enhances their abilities. As long as a centipede is within 60 feet of at least one other centipede, it has advantage on initiative rolls and {@skill Perception} checks. If one centipede is aware of a particular danger, all others in the hive are, too. No centipede in a hive mind is surprised at the beginning of an encounter unless all of them are. In addition, a centipede gains a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to the number of centipedes within 60 feet of it (maximum +5).

trait.name: Otherworldly Communication
entries: The centipede can communicate via subsonic sounds with other aberrations, aquatic creatures with 6 or less Intelligence, and insects within 60 feet of it. This is a silent and instantaneous mode of communication that the other creatures can understand. As a bonus action, the centipede can use this trait to control and give orders to one creature or swarm of creatures (e.g. a {@creature swarm of insects}) of CR 1 or lower that understands it within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Inexorable Movement
entries: When the centipede moves into the space of a creature that is Large or smaller, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} check (creature's choice) or become {@condition grappled} by the centipede. The centipede can {@action grapple} up to 100 creatures and its speed isn't halved by {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centipede makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its pincers.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage and 6 ({@damage 1d12}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. The centipede has advantage on the attack roll if it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} the target.

bonus.name: Crawl
entries: The centipede moves up to its speed.

reaction.name: Regurgitate {@recharge 5}
entries: After being hit by an attack, the centipede exhales a stream of acidic ichor in a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 26 ({@damage 4d12}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

footerEntries: * Orr always succeeds on the saving throw for this spell

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: Orr can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Cold Absorption
entries: Whenever Orr is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

trait.name: Divine Rejuvenation
entries: When Orr drops to 0 hit points, its body collapses into a writhing mass of flesh, whereupon Orr instantly reappears in its {@creature Orr, The Grieving Rebirth (Second Form)|SGttEH|second form} in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of where its first form was destroyed. Its initiative count doesn't change.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: Orr ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Orr is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Orr fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Orr's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Orr makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage and 13 ({@damage 2d12}) cold damage. If a creature is damaged by this attack twice before the start of Orr's next turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Scream (3/Day)
entries: Orr emits a scream of pure rage and agony. Each time it screams before finishing a long rest, the scream is louder and the effect is different, as detailed below. Each creature within 500 feet of Orr and able to hear the scream must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw.

items.name: Scream of Pain
entries: Each creature that fails its save is affected by crippling pain for 1 minute. For the duration, the creature's speeds are reduced to 10 feet and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, other than Constitution saving throws. Further, if the target tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, or the casting fails and the spell is wasted. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Scream Of Harvest
entries: Each creature that fails its save becomes vulnerable to necrotic and cold damage for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Scream of Death
entries: Each creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage and 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: Orr magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space.

reaction.name: Warp Magic
