entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Engage only if it threatens innocents. Despite its lack of reason, it stands as an ally against the Scourge.
If combat's a must, disable its eye to protect your arcane powers.
Dangerously lethal up close, yet vulnerable from afar.

entries: {@color {@font |radiantcross} For the eyes of apostles and higher ranks only|--rgb-name}
{@creature Butcher|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Beast

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Wield moongold; common weapons falter.
Tempt with corpses; its hunger is unyielding.
{@u2 Evade darkness!} Illuminate your surroundings or face its stealthy onslaught.
Divert from untrained citizens; they are easy fodder, and absorbing their shadows empowers and fortifies it immensely.

entries: {@creature Cervus Tenebris|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical Undead

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: {@u2 Flee!!}
Inform your chain of command {@u2 at once}; elites will be en route.
Should combat be inevitable, arm thyself with silver; naught else shall pierce her.
Beware her bone's curse! Sever any limb tainted, or becomes ossified. Better a maimed hunter than no hunter at all.

entries: {@creature Cloistered Maiden|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Beast

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Ordinary weapons barely scratch its hide.
Confront only in sizable groups; remember the hunter's motto.
{@u2 Keep distance;} one strike may sever limbs.
Avoid rooftop provocations; height won't deter its pursuit.
Do {@u2 not} turn your back on it.
Wield moongold to halt its healing.

entries: {@creature Devouring Belua|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Weak to the Radiant One's light; engage within hallowed grounds to erode its being.
Arm yourself with {@u2 moongold blades}.
Fortify your psyche against its madness.
Swift and fixated on a sole prey; bolting your entrance won't deter it.
Should its arcane bind you, seek swift nullification or it'll relentlessly track you.
If hexed, avoid returning to base; if necessary, martyr yourself for the collective good.

entries: {@color {@font |radiantcross} Classified|--rgb-name}
{@creature Dullahan|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Beast

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Frequent foe of the Scourge.
Potent in packs; {@u2 do not} get surrounded.
When stalking it, mask your essence with dung or mire.
Target the bloated ones last; their deathly miasma strengthens their kin.
Though these horrors must die, keep your fury in check; act with deliberate intent.

entries: {@creature Fallen Luyarnhian|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Beast

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Heresy of the Scions, {@u2 do not use} lightning against it
Shun open skies; it wields storms.
Capable of {@u2 explosive rebirths}.
Favour an elite few hunters; large squads risk grave losses.
Speed unmatched; stay vigilant against its surprise assaults.

entries: {@color {@font |radiantcross} Classified|--rgb-name}
{@creature Galvanised Prowler|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Undead

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Beware, it mirrors dear ones; a dark ruse to waver your resolve. Stay true, for you face the already fallen.
Arm allies with mundane weapons. It shifts from ghostly to solid; only simple arms touch its phantom self.
{@u2 Vital:} Silver and moongold pierce it, no matter the form.
Immune to chilling death's touch; cold won't sway it.

entries: {@creature Geist|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Immobile.
Employs blasphemous rites; avoid confrontation.
Report newfound intel regarding its origins and intentions directly to Grand Cathedral's apostles.
One entity spotted in the Moryanne; monitor closely, engage only if provoked.

entries: {@color {@font |radiantcross} Classified|--rgb-name}
{@creature Dreamer's Minor Avatar|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: {@color Classified|--rgb-name}

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Weapon against the Scourge.
Boasts multiple organ replicas; termination is a challenge.
{@u2 Imperative:} Indoctrination before instruction.
Swift and lethal; use measures to hinder their mental faculties, then eliminate.

entries: {@color {@font |radiantcross} For the eyes of apostles and higher ranks only|--rgb-name}
{@creature Jaeger|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Volatile nature; {@u2 erupts} upon demise.
Operative of the Church.
Seek shelter from its blasts.
Strike with haste; delay lets it outpace and bombard your team.
Disperse your ranks.
Arm yourself with silver and arcane trick weapons.

entries: {@color {@font |radiantcross} Classified|--rgb-name}
{@creature Living Artillery|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: If in their vicinity, shun sleep.
Numb your emotions.
{@u2 Do not} look at its face.
Do Not Look.
Do Not...
Do...

entries: {@color {@font |radiantcross} Classified|--rgb-name}
{@creature Nightgaunt|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Monstrous

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Lethal, yet lacks wit.
Loathes radiance; it's drawn to light-bearers. Makes it predictable. Your vanguard should lure it with hallowed spells or blessed waters.
Guard your allies from its clutches. If ensnared, free them promptly; its maw knows every frailty of flesh.

entries: {@creature Owlbear|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical Humanoid

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Maintain distance between allies.
Target its limbs and prevent reattachment, {@u2 especially} from its crucible.
Guard your limbs fiercely!
Blinding it is futile; it feels heartbeats.
Keep your distance; its grasp spells doom.
Shatter its crucible to weaken its might.

entries: {@creature Penitent|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Machine

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: It consumes remains entirely; employed to clear hunt traces and soothe the masses.
Aggravate not their masters, lest they retaliate.
Its chest-blade can rend flesh instantly; {@u2 avoid its grip.}
Charm, if possible, to our side; a potential ally in its might.

entries: {@creature Razorblade Bitzer|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Beast (extinct)

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Secure high ground; they can tunnel below.
Avoid mental manipulation spells.
Fearful of, and harmed by, thunderous sounds. {@u2 Heavy artillery} recommended.
After the kill, convey remains to the Grand Cathedral.

entries: {@creature Roaring Mane|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Manlike? Warps reality with eldritch power.

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Avoid mending near it. Holy ones, {@u2 flee!} It relishes hunting the devout.
{@u2 Fire hazard!}
Its glow can weaken a hunter's spirit. Stay resolute!

entries: {@creature Scorched Adjudicator|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Beast

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Lacks wit; overpower with numbers.
Muzzle its maw to deter deadliest blows.
Feeds to mend; prevent it from consuming!
Only silver harms; other weapons, even arcane, are {@u2 futile.}
Forbear confrontation during an Eldritch Moon.
Douse yourself in beast repellent; its scent deters them. Remain out of sight as scent alone won't shield you.

entries: {@creature Scourge Lycan|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Beast

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: Ground them to cripple their mobility.
Timid by nature; eliminate the alpha, and the rest scatter.
Their piercing cry can bewilder, pre-seal ears with wax.
Skilled blade-wielders; disarm swiftly, or better, {@u2 immobilize.}

entries: {@creature Screechwing|SGttEH}

entries.name: Type:
entries: Heretical Beast

entries.name: Hunt Notes:
items: {@u2 Run.}
No reports of hunters surviving this breed of aranea.
Capture or kill for autopsy. Bounty: {@u2 10,000gp}

entries: {@creature Soul-Snatching Aranea|SGttEH}

entries.name: Firearms
entries: Firearms were created out of a dire need to fight the scourge. They all include silver in their construction, and as such, the projectiles they fire are considered silvered for the purposes of overcoming resistances and immunities.
Some firearm and ammunition properties require your target to make a saving throw to avoid the effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

entries.name: Artillery
entries: You must use Strength instead of Dexterity for the Firearm save DC and the attack and damage rolls of this weapon. Such a weapon can be fired once before it must be reloaded with an action.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use.

entries.name: Barrel
entries: The weapon can be fired a number of times equal to the number of bullets its barrel can hold (written as Barrel X) before it must be reloaded according to its fast or slow reload property (F or S, respectively).

items.name: Fast Reload
entries: You must use an attack, an action, or a bonus action to reload this firearm. You must have one free hand to do so.

items.name: Slow Reload
entries: You must use an attack or an action to reload this firearm. You must have one free hand to do so.

entries.name: Blaring
entries: Firing this weapon makes a thunderous crack. The sound can be heard from up to 100 feet away. Firing a weapon with this property makes it hard to go undetected; you have disadvantage on {@skill Stealth} checks to hide until the start of your next turn. In addition, if a creature is within the area of the sound blast, it has advantage on {@skill Perception} checks against you.

entries.name: Booming
entries: The deflagration from firing this weapon makes a stupendous booming sound. The sound can be heard from up to 500 feet away. Firing this weapon makes it impossible to go undetected; you automatically fail {@skill Stealth} checks to hide until the start of your next turn. In addition, if a creature is within the area of the sound blast, it automatically succeeds on {@skill Perception} checks against you.

entries.name: Concussive
entries: These weapons bludgeon as much as they pierce. When determining a creature's resistance or immunity to damage from this weapon, use the weaker of the target's resistance or immunity to piercing or to bludgeoning damage. For instance, if a creature is immune to piercing damage and has no resistance or immunity to bludgeoning damage, it would take full damage from a concussive weapon. Resistance to all physical damage applies as normal.

entries.name: Fan Fire
entries: You can quickly fire this weapon by slamming the hammer repeatedly. As an action, you fire a number of bullets in a row equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 2, up to the entirety of the barrel). Each attack after the first suffers a cumulative −3 penalty to the attack roll. You cannot add any modifier to the damage roll of these attacks beyond the first (such as the bonus from your Dexterity modifier, the {@feat Sharp-shooter|SGttEH} feat, or a magic weapon's bonus to damage rolls). When you use this action, your speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn, and attacks you make using the long range of the weapon automatically miss.

If you roll a 1 on any of the attack rolls, the weapon jams and can't be used again until it is repaired. You can use an action to make a {@dc 15} {@skill Sleight of Hand} check, repairing the weapon on a success. Alternatively, you can spend 1 hour outside of combat to mend it, automatically succeeding on the check. If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended in a specialist's store at a quarter of the cost of the firearm.

entries.name: Twinned Barrel
entries: This weapon has two barrels that can each hold a bullet and can both be loaded as part of reloading the weapon. You can fire both barrels of a double barrel weapon as part of an attack, instead of each barrel individually. Doing so empties the barrel of the weapon (as per the Barrel property) but increases the damage die of the weapon on a hit (from {@damage d4} to {@damage d6} to {@damage d8} to {@damage d10} to {@damage d12}).

entries.name: Spread Fire
entries: A weapon that has the spread fire property can't make a normal attack, instead spraying a cone in front of you with a length equal to its range (for example, a blunderbuss with 'range 20' will fire in a 20-foot cone in front of you). Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Firearm save DC or take the weapon's normal damage.

entries.name: Steady
entries: A weapon with this property can be stabilized for greater accuracy. As a bonus action, you give yourself a bonus to your next attack roll with this weapon this turn equal to your proficiency bonus, and attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during your turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is halved until the end of your turn.

data.name: Steinhardt's Madness System

entries: {@note This chapter is a {@b truncated} copy of the similarly titled chapter "{@book Steinhardt's Madness System|SGttEH|20}" in the main book.}

Steinhardt's Guide to the Eldritch Hunt contains numerous aberrations that can assail creature's minds. The following rules and effect detail the myriad ways that characters' minds can be debased, debauched, or otherwise defiled.

entries.name: Madness Effects
entries: Madness can be short-term, long-term, or indefinite. More mundane effects, like the ones presented here, impose short-term madness, which lasts for just a few minutes. More horrific effects or cumulative effects can result in long-term or indefinite madness.
A creature's intellect can help it understand eldritch knowledge without breaking its mind. Characters can add their Intelligence modifier to saving throws they make against madness.

items: When a creature becomes afflicted by madness, be it short-term, long-term or indefinite, the creature is {@condition stunned} (see the condition) until the start of its next turn, and then the madness takes effect.
A character afflicted with short-term madness is subjected to an effect from the Short-Term Madness table for {@dice 1d4} minutes.

A character afflicted with long-term madness is subjected to an effect from the Long-Term Madness table for {@dice 1d4}  Eldritch Moons (or {@dice 1d4  7} days, if you aren't using Eldritch Moons in your world).
A character afflicted with indefinite madness gains a new trait from the Indefinite Madness table that lasts until cured.

entries.name: Madness and the Ethereal Plane
entries: When a creature in Luyarnha enters the Ethereal Plane for the first time in a day, they must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or gain a short-term madness and immediately be returned to the plane they were last on. Creatures of the GM's choice are immune to this effect.
For each minute spent on the Ethereal Plane, a creature must repeat the saving throw.For each minute spent on the Ethereal Plane, a creature must repeat the saving throw.

entries.name: Curing Madness
entries: Different types of madness have different methods for curing them. What can cure indefinite madness can also cure long-term and short-term madness, and what can cure long-term madness can also cure short-term madness. The opposite isn't true.

entries.name: Short-term madness:
entries: A character suffering from short-term madness can be cured with a {@spell lesser restoration} spell or by waiting for the madness to subside naturally.

entries.name: Long-term madness:
entries: A character suffering from long-term madness can be cured with a {@spell greater restoration} spell or a {@spell modify memory} spell if the traumatic event happened in the time window necessary for the spell to work.

entries.name: Indefinite madness:
entries: A character suffering from indefinite madness can be cured with a {@spell wish} spell. Alternatively, they can be killed and brought back completely sane with a {@spell true resurrection} spell.

If you want to make indefinite madness easier to remove, you can allow the use of {@spell greater restoration} to cure the character if both the caster and the target are located within an area sanctified by a {@spell hallow} spell.

entries.name: GM Note:
entries: A drunk or intoxicated character could suffer one or all the following effects: Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks; −{@dice 1d4} penalty to its attack rolls; Advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Temporary Cures
entries: Sometimes curing madness is impossible, and alleviating the symptoms is the only option. What can temporarily cure indefinite madness can also temporarily cure long-term and short-term madness, and what can temporarily cure long-term madness can also temporarily cure short-term madness. The opposite isn't true.

entries.name: Short-term madness:
entries: A character suffering from short-term madness can be temporarily cured by:

items: A {@spell calm emotions} spell for the duration of the spell.
Having a Momentum die (e.g., {@class Jaeger|SGttEH} in battle).

entries.name: Long-term madness:
entries: character suffering from longterm madness can be temporarily cured by:

items: Being within the area of a {@spell hallow} or {@spell holy aura} spell.
Being under the effect of a {@spell mind blank} spell.
Being located inside of a holy site dedicated to a god that wards off eldritch influences (such as the Radiant One or the Abyss Warden).
Being severely under the influence of alcohol or other drugs.

entries.name: Indefinite madness:
entries: A character suffering from indefinite madness can be temporarily cured by:

items: Being located inside of a holy site dedicated to a god that wards off eldritch influences (such as the Radiant One or the Abyss Warden) or a {@spell hallow} spell and being under the effect of a {@spell mind blank} or {@spell holy aura} spell.
